description:
We provide a fantastic environment where you can make new contacts within the International Community. You may want to widen your circle of friends, or seek out a new business partner - we take care of both. We are housed in the historic building of the Autoworld Museum, at the Heart of the Parc du Cinquantenaire. Mérode metro is but a short walk and we have ample parking. The 629 Club meets every Thursday and there are opportunities to eat, play golf on our terrace putting green, win a glass of Cava at our fun roulette table, learn to salsa, dance to the music of our international DJs, and obtain information about life in Belgium. Doors open at 18h00 and you can dance until 01h00. We are a large group, about 250 now, this makes for great fun and wonderful opportunities. To find out more try the following web sites or give me a call.
www.6to9.be
www.espace53.be
Chalks -[masked]

description:
Meet the Expert @ the Expatica Café, Brussels

Join us for a learning workshop at the Expatica café. This is an opportunity to learn from an expert, how to develop a strong business proposition.
Below, you will find information about the workshop, the workshop leader’s bio, together with location, joining instructions and cost and participation fees.

About the workshop:

“Making every word count”

One of the main ways we build our businesses is by networking. People, as they say, buy from people.

However, what do we say when we meet potential customers which will make us stand out as the best people to solve their urgent problems?

A strong business proposition is one key to success, and in difficult economic times our propositions have to be more compelling than ever to persuade potential customers to invest in our products and services rather than simply to hang onto their money.

This workshop will make available to you the tools and techniques developed by Mud Valley (http://www.mudvalley....) and used by major organisations – business owners and consultancies – across the world to systematise their approach to developing fresh, compelling propositions.

The techniques include:

1. “Unique market definition” – what can you offer your customers that is unique?
2. “Customer laddering” – what do your target customers really want, deep down?
3. “Attacking the market leader” – use your competitors’ strength to your own advantage
4. “Outright proposition ownership” – develop your fresh, compelling proposition
5. “Elevator speech” – distil your proposition down to one persuasive sentence

Participants will also be given a free Mud Valley 20-pager e-booklet on formulating strong business propositions, plus twelve key tools, built in Excel, to enable you to build on your experiences during this workshop as your business develops.

If you can bring along a laptop, you will be able to use these tools live during the session – however, while this is desirable it is not critical. The workshop will first and foremost be built around a lively discussion in which you can use the resources of fellow-attendees to help you become a winner in your chosen market.


The workshop leader:

Biography

Tim Hewtson le Roux is the Managing Director of Mud Valley and Valley Strategies (the consultancy arm of Mud Valley).

He set up Mud Valley with five fellow directors to share knowledge of “best practice” business and brand marketing strategy techniques with other practitioners. It is Mud Valley’s belief that a good strategy built in-house with full involvement from the eventual implementers of that strategy will nearly always out-perform strategies developed by outside consultancies, as the success of a strategy ultimately lies in its committed execution.

Before setting up Valley Strategies in 2006, Tim Hewtson le Roux was the Brand Strategy Manager EMEA for a major global corporation, where he was involved in the improved professionalism of how its brands were managed (which included driving through a significant brand rationalisation programme), and then Strategy & Planning Manager EMEA for the same company where he worked with a hand-picked MBA team to develop human systems to identify the best market opportunities for 40 businesses across 60 countries, and then to reallocate resources accordingly. This technique led to five groups of companies turning around their business performance almost immediately, including one which had been in decline for 10 years.

Tim is also the author of several fictional novels, including “Girl on a Bar Stool” which showcases brand marketing techniques and issues throughout the plot. It has been likened to Eliyahu M. Goldratt’s “The Goal”, the groundbreaking fictional explanation of process quality techniques.

Workshop location, date and timing:

Thursday 27 November - 09h30 to 14h30

Expatica Café
(Le Pablos)
Rue François Gay, 152
Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
1150 Brussels

(Corner of Avenue du val D’or)
Tram; 39 & 44 – stop; Chien Vert or Jules Ceaser
Metro; Montgomery


Registration and Fees:

Investment per person is €150.00, which includes handouts, tea, coffee, water during the workshop and a 2 course lunch, with drinks, in the Restaurant Le Pablos.

You place will only be confirmed once payment has been received.
Maximum of 8 participants for this workshop.


To register, please contact Chalks:

Expatica Communications B.V. is a born-global media company. It began in 2000 in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, as a news and information site for internationals and quickly expanded to encompass a much broader resource for internationals living abroad. Within a few years, Expatica also expanded geographically to include Belgium, France, Spain, Germany and Switzerland. The UK and Italy will be the next additions to the growing Expatica family.

Expatica’s deep reach within these markets ensures that your message will be put in front of one of the most attractive target audiences in Continental Europe. More than any other publication - with our combination of online, print and events - Expatica reaches the largest group of genuine, qualified internationals. Online, in print and in person, Expatica connects with more than 5 million unique individuals each year.

description:
Meet the Expert @ the Expatica Café, Brussels

Join us for a learning workshop at the Expatica café. This is an opportunity to learn from an expert, how to develop a strong business proposition.
If you no longer wish to receive information about events from Chalks, please reply to this email with the word “unsubscribe” in the subject line.
Below, you will find information about the workshop, the workshop leader’s bio, together with location, joining instructions and cost and participation fees.

About the workshop:

“Making every word count”

One of the main ways we build our businesses is by networking. People, as they say, buy from people.

However, what do we say when we meet potential customers which will make us stand out as the best people to solve their urgent problems?

A strong business proposition is one key to success, and in difficult economic times our propositions have to be more compelling than ever to persuade potential customers to invest in our products and services rather than simply to hang onto their money.

This workshop will make available to you the tools and techniques developed by Mud Valley (http://www.mudvalley....) and used by major organisations – business owners and consultancies – across the world to systematise their approach to developing fresh, compelling propositions.

The techniques include:

1. “Unique market definition” – what can you offer your customers that is unique?
2. “Customer laddering” – what do your target customers really want, deep down?
3. “Attacking the market leader” – use your competitors’ strength to your own advantage
4. “Outright proposition ownership” – develop your fresh, compelling proposition
5. “Elevator speech” – distil your proposition down to one persuasive sentence

Participants will also be given a free Mud Valley 20-pager e-booklet on formulating strong business propositions, plus twelve key tools, built in Excel, to enable you to build on your experiences during this workshop as your business develops.

If you can bring along a laptop, you will be able to use these tools live during the session – however, while this is desirable it is not critical. The workshop will first and foremost be built around a lively discussion in which you can use the resources of fellow-attendees to help you become a winner in your chosen market.


The workshop leader:

Biography

Tim Hewtson le Roux is the Managing Director of Mud Valley and Valley Strategies (the consultancy arm of Mud Valley).

He set up Mud Valley with five fellow directors to share knowledge of “best practice” business and brand marketing strategy techniques with other practitioners. It is Mud Valley’s belief that a good strategy built in-house with full involvement from the eventual implementers of that strategy will nearly always out-perform strategies developed by outside consultancies, as the success of a strategy ultimately lies in its committed execution.

Before setting up Valley Strategies in 2006, Tim Hewtson le Roux was the Brand Strategy Manager EMEA for a major global corporation, where he was involved in the improved professionalism of how its brands were managed (which included driving through a significant brand rationalisation programme), and then Strategy & Planning Manager EMEA for the same company where he worked with a hand-picked MBA team to develop human systems to identify the best market opportunities for 40 businesses across 60 countries, and then to reallocate resources accordingly. This technique led to five groups of companies turning around their business performance almost immediately, including one which had been in decline for 10 years.

Tim is also the author of several fictional novels, including “Girl on a Bar Stool” which showcases brand marketing techniques and issues throughout the plot. It has been likened to Eliyahu M. Goldratt’s “The Goal”, the groundbreaking fictional explanation of process quality techniques.

description:
Meet the Expert @ the Expatica Café, Brussels

Join us for a networking and learning event at the Expatica café. This is an opportunity to learn from experts, about how to set-up a business, NGO or trade association in Belgium.

The Experts are:
Louise Hilditch and Julie Kolokotsa.

Summary of the Local Knowledge Guide, their consultancy services and who they are

About the book
In only one hundred pages, the Local Knowledge Guide to setting up and running your business in Belgium contains all the essential information that you need to set up a new business in Belgium. Whether you are opening a representation office or starting your own business, this invaluable guide sets out clearly the key issues you need to work out before you start, making sure that you don't waste any time or money. It is packed full of tips, checklists and 'bottom lines' so you won't forget anything or make an expensive administrative error.

The book has the great virtue of being concise while containing all the key information required. The layout guides the reader in an easy-to-follow format through the complex maze of Belgian requirements.

It is indispensable if you are setting up a representation office for local government, a trade association, an NGO or your own business.

About the business
Setting up your business: We can assist with legal and practical aspects of establishing your new venture in Belgium.

Running your business: We work to ensure your business operations run smoothly so you can focus on your core business.

Managing your suppliers: We will source reliable and effective suppliers on your behalf.

About the authors
Louise Hilditch came to Belgium from the UK in 1993 and after working for a number of years in the European Parliament, went on to work for a major multinational food corporation as a lobbyist before leaving to co-found a successful public affairs consultancy with Julie Kolokotsa. She has since set up and managed several not-for-profit organisations in Belgium and elsewhere in the EU. She now runs a consultancy aimed at advising small businesses and organisations how to set up and run successful ventures in Belgium.

Julie Kolokotsa came to Belgium from the US in 1991 and after working for several years in the European Parliament co-founded a successful public affairs and event management consultancy. She has worked for an impressive number of blue chip companies over the past 15 years and her latest venture is aimed at advising other small businesses on how to succeed.

More book details
The first chapter contains an overview of the business environment in Belgium and sets out the pros and cons of being based in Belgium.

Chapter 2 outlines the legal registration process and walks the reader through the different options and advantages for incorporation and registration. It summarises the different options for incorporation and presents a step by step guide to registration.

Chapter 3 covers all you need to know to get started as an employer. This is a complex area of law; it is both heavily regulated and closely monitored by the Belgian authorities so you need to make sure you get it right. The question and answer format guides you effortlessly through the complex legislation relating to hiring staff, gives guidance on salary expectations of employees and what it could cost you and summarises Belgian government incentives relating to employment.

Chapter 4 analyses the tax and finance aspects of being self-employed. It provides advice on finding the right accountant for you as well as pointers to make sure you make the most of your situation from a tax point of view. The useful list of questions to ask prospective accountants are invaluable for anyone wondering how on earth to go about selecting one and the tables at the end of this chapter capture clearly and concisely how to calculate your own salary as a company director for maximum advantage.

The final chapter covers some of the key suppliers that entrepreneurs will rely on to run their business. It provides information to help you get started in your search for reliable contractors be it telecom needs, banking or legal advice. At the end of the book, a list of useful websites and a valuable glossary of relevant terms in English, French and Dutch complete the guide.

The book will be on sale at the event at a discounted rate of €20.00.

description:
Meet the Expert @ the Expatica Café, Brussels

Join us for a Round Table presentation and discussion about Hedge Funds at the Expatica café. This is an opportunity to learn from a UBS expert the Myths and Reality.
Below, you will find information about the workshop, the workshop leader’s information, together with location and registration instructions.

The concept underlying the presentation:
One of the key purposes is to help attendees sort out the increased information flow about hedge funds in the media. The presentation quickly covers the main characteristics of hedge funds, a fundamental step in understanding them.
We consequently cover the credit crisis that started in 2007 and how it will impact the hedge funds industry going forward. In the light of these recent events, we try to answer whether an investment in hedge funds today is still warranted.

The structure of the presentation is set out below:

Basic concepts:
What are Hedge Funds?
Strategies,
Risk / Return Characteristics of Hedge Funds

What happened in 2008?
Events & impact on Hedge Funds

Are Hedge Funds still a viable investment?

Questions and Answers

Presented by:
Gregory Christians
Director, Head Products & Services Consulting Investments & Advisory
UBS Belgium SA/NV
Avenue de Tervueren, 300, Tervurenlaan
B-1150 Brussels

Expatica Networking Events @ Espace53 Brussels
Join us every Friday in March for a networking evening at Espace53 (Autoworld). This is a great way to meet other internationals living and working in Europe’s capital, enjoy a drink or meal in a majestic building, and welcome the weekend.
Expatica Communications would like to invite you to join us for some fun – every Friday in March, after work. Espace53 is located inside the historic buildings of the Autoworld Museum – Cinquantenaire Parc.

Parking is fantastic, Merode and Schuman metro stations are but a short walk, and everything you could want to start your weekend is on hand. Eat, drink, dance, chat, flirt and network – what ever takes your fancy!

Friday’s 6, 13, 20 and 27 March 2009

Espace53
(Autoworld)
11 Parc du Cinquantenaire (Jubelpark)
1000 Bruxelles/Brussels

Metro’s – Merode or Schuman
Very good parking
name: Network - Eat - Dance - Meet new people - Start the weekend......

description:
Join us for a coffee morning and networking evening every Thursday.

It’s a great way to meet other internationals living and working in Europe’s capital.
Expatica Communications would like to invite you to join us every Thursday morning for coffee or tea, and on Thursday evenings for a networking drink.

You can pick-up flyers about what is going on in Belgium, and meet some of the Expatica team members who will do everything they can to answer any questions you may have.

Every Thursday in 2009
Coffee morning – 10h00 to 12h00
Networking drinks – 19h00 to 21h00

The Expatica Cafe is under renovation for the moment - we shall meet at our other location for the moment;

Espace53
(Autoworld)
11 Parc du Cinquantenaire
1000
Brussels

description:
Expatica Cocktail event @ Espace53 (Autoworld Museum) Brussels 1000

This is an opportunity to get together, share experiences, flirt, have fun and build up your networks - whilst enjoying a drink and some tapas. An added bonus is that this event takes place inside the majestic buildings of the Autoworld Museum at Cinquantenaire.

Do come along, bring a friend and enjoy a fun evening with Expatica’s community.
The event will be hosted by Chalks, Expatica’s local representative in Brussels.

The event costs €10.00 per head; payable in advance – this covers 2 drinks and the tapas style snacks.

Reservation is mandatory as the event is limited to 50 places.

Date & Time:
Thursday 23 April - 19h30 to 21h00
Location:
Espace53 (Autoworld)
11 Parc du Cinquantenaire
1000 Brussels

For more information please contact Chalks;
[masked]
[masked]
www.expatica.com
GSM:[masked]

Small print:
• Please arrive on time as the inclusive element of this event ends at 21h00,
• Should you require a receipt for your payment, do ask on arrival at the event,
• Funds will be returned for cancellations up to 48hrs in advance of the event,
• The venue will close at midnight,
• Dancing, laughing and flirting will be encouraged,
• Autoworld has fantastic parking and public transport connections,
• All questions about this event should be directed to Chalks.

description:
Are you an international living, working in or moving to Belgium?

Looking for opportunities and information to make the most of life abroad?

Then, join us for the first Expatica "I am not a tourist" Fair in Brussels - Sunday 14 June 2009 - Espace53 (Autoworld Museum) Cinquantenaire 11h00 to 18h00.

This is Expatica´s lifestyle fair for internationals and expatriates living and working outside of their home country. The event is already a major success in France and the Netherlands, and will now become a regular fixture for Internationals in Belgium.

Entrance is FREE!

It is our intention to offer services for the new arrivals to Belgium, as well as those that have lived in Belgium for some time.

If you need more information please contact Chalks.

Chalks Corriette
Sales and Community Development
Expatica Communications – Belgium
Expatica Café
rue Francois Gay 152
Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
1150 Brussels
GSM:[masked]
[masked]
www.expatica.com

Espace53 (Autoworld Museum), 11 Parc du Cinquantenaire, 1000 Brussels.
Date: Sunday, 14 June 2009
Time: 11h00 to 18h00

The "i am not a tourist" Fair is a unique opportunity to get all the information and contacts you need in one place. Within a single day, you'll have the chance to meet groups and clubs, service providers, experts, and other expats. If you're looking for a house or a job, starting a business, or just want to meet other internationals, the "i am not a tourist" Fair is for you!

Directions by Public Transportation
Schuman and Merode Metro stops are but a short walk through Cinquantenaire Park. Espace53 is located inside the historic Autoworld Museum. The location boasts parking for almost 600 cars – Brussels central station is a short taxi ride or a short metro journey, for those traveling from other cities such as Antwerp and Ghent.

Directions by Car
• It is best to enter the location via the Avenue de Tervuren end of the Park, rather than the Schuman end.
• If your GPS system does not find Parc du Cinquantenaire, Bruxelles – you can enter Avenue des Nerviens or Avenue des Gaulois.
• The entrance to car parking area is via Avenue des Gaulois.

Parking
• Cinquantenaire Park has around 600 parking places. This is a public area and there are 2 other museums in the same Park. Paid street parking in the area is reasonable.
• As public transport is so good to this venue, we would encourage you to take this option.
name: Expatica "I am not a tourist" Fair in Brussels

description:
Expatica Wine Tasting Event @ Espace53 2 July 2009

Expatica and R99 would like to invite you to a wine tasting on Thursday 2 July 2009. This is an opportunity to get together, share experiences, flirt, have fun and build up your networks - whilst enjoying an evening with a wine selection from the Western Cape vineyards of South Africa.
An added bonus is that this event takes place inside the majestic buildings of the Autoworld Museum within the Cinquantenaire Parc.
Join us and try the diversity of the Western Cape vineyards, to show that South Africa is not all about rugby, braai (bbq), safaris & white sandy beaches. South Africa has also been making some "baie lekker wyn" for the last 350 years.

Thursday 2 July – 19h30
Espace53 (first floor) – Autoworld Museum, 11 Parc du Cinquantenaire, 1000 Brussels. Metro stop: Merode – Venue has a large parking area. Restaurant is open should you wish to have a meal before the tasting.

Cost: 25.00 euro per person – payable in advance of the event

Event Theme: Wines of South Africa

Should this be of interest to you, please sign up now as numbers are limited to 40 - and we have a waiting list from the last time this event was run.

To register and make payment, please go to:
http://www.meetup.com... registration is simple - once you confirm participation you will be presented with a secure service to make your payment.

Do come along, bring a friend and enjoy a fun evening with Expatica’s International Community (the Expaticans), living and working in Europe’s capital.

Best regards,
Elizma and Chalks

Elizma Myburgh
R99 Wine Consulting
Belgium

[masked]
www.r99.be

Need more information? Please contact Chalks;

Chalks Corriette
Community Development - Expatica Belgium

description:
Attitude

We are a community of people heading towards 40 or have passed 40, with a young and lively attitude about life. Our social networking involves interesting spaces, good food and drinks, opportunities to dance and the ability to meet new people, flirt a little and have lots of fun.

Join us every first Friday of the month from 4 September (2 October, 6 November and 4 December) 2009.

“Our launch event on 10 July was an unexpected success. I am excited about this concept for us mature stylish folks” Chalks Corriette – Community Development, Expatica.

description:
Illuminate your international life:

Sunday 18 October 2009 (11h00 to 18h00) - Experience the second "i am not a tourist" Fair in Brussels. This is Expatica´s lifestyle fair for internationals and expatriates living and working in Belgium. Mark it down in your calendar and visit us at Espace53 (Autoworld Museum), Cinquantenaire - Brussels. Bring your family and friends for a fun day out.

The "i am not a tourist" Fair will have a range of valuable resources from previous European fairs, but with extra attention given to lifestyle and community related resources for the experienced expat. Those of you who already have your bearings in Belgium can therefore enjoy as many of the features as the newcomers, including food, entertainment and networking fixtures. A number of artists and photographers, Belgian and international, will also be exhibiting their work.

So even if you have lived in Belgium for some time already, do come to our fair to discover what's going on in the rest of the expat community and learn more about your adopted country. Our fair is all about enriching your life abroad, whether you are new to the expat lifestyle or an experienced hand!

Regarding those practical necessities, for those new to Belgium and in need of information, our fair will supply a selection of the best expat resources this country has to offer. The "i am not a tourist" Fair brings a broad range of companies and agencies who specialise in expatriate services together under one roof. From banks, investment firms and insurance companies to schools, local clubs and tax agencies, all have their place at our fair. The stand holders are there to help you with house and job hunting, immigration and permits, staying long term, starting your own business, having fun and more.
Whether you've lived in Belgium for 5 months, 5 years or even if you haven't yet made the move, you will surely find something of interest to you.

The "i am not a tourist" Fair gives you access to the international community, be it through individuals, groups, clubs, or businesses. This one-day fair will present a wealth of information and resources to boost your life abroad. So join us on Sunday 18 October, for what will become an expat institution.

Espace53
Parc du Cinquantenaire, 11
1000 Brussels

Merode Metro - all details and exhibitors at www.expatica.be

chalks -[masked]
name: i am not a tourist - LifeStyle Fair for International People Living in Belgium

description:
EXPATICA CAFE

News broadcast – 9 January 2010

This communication is to provide an update on the renovation activities of the Expatica Café. We are impacted by the weather as a number of important items have not been delivered or installed.

Doors open for business
We shall be in the building from 12 January and should anyone like to pop in and see us, they are very welcome. Please consider that you will see us completing some of the work and we may not look our best!

So, with that in mind we would like to invite you to the initial opening:
Thursday 14 January from 19h00 – Welcome and Opening cocktail,

You will be able to meet us, take a look around the Café, have a drink and enjoy some tapas. The Grill will open at the end of January – but the bar and other activities will be available. All workshops and events will have catering provided by our partner team at Espace53 during the month of January.

Activities – Events – Workshops
14 January from 19h00 – Welcome and Opening cocktail,
17 January from 15h00 – Swap Shop until 17h00,
21 January – (daily) various clubs, individuals and networks meet informally,
21 January, every Thursday from 19h00 – Internationals meet to network in the bar,
22 January from 19h30 – Cheese and Wine event (with Registration),
29 January from 19h00 – DHL Alumni networking,
11 February from 09h30 – Coaching workshops with RobinsonHenry,
13 February from 22h00 – Valentines Day Party at Autoworld until 05h00,
19 February from 20h00 – Whisky tasting,


Every first Friday of the month the Attitude social networking event takes place at Espace53 (Autoworld Museum) Cinquantenaire Park (18h00 to midnight – drinks, tapas, dancing).

Details about our activities and events can be found in the Expatica What’s On area: http://www.expatica.c...

Please contact me should you have any questions at all.

Chalks Corriette
Country Manager – Expatica Belgium
Director – Red Invest sprl
[masked]

[masked]
[masked]
www.expatica.com

The Expatica Café is operated by Red Invest sprl;
www.redinvest.be
[masked]
name: Expatica Cafe - Open's Today!

description:
Expatica Cafe and Red Invest

Are proud to invite you to our first

Swap Shop

Join us on Sunday 17 January – 15h00 to 17h00.

The current economic climate, people wanting to share or re-use items – with the added bonus of networking and making some money are the key to this concept.

The Expatica Swap-Shop provides a setting to allow Internationals to meet, sell, or swap items that they no longer need. In the future, these gatherings can be simple or more formal, with possibly a specialist coming in to offer guidance, or purchase items e.g. a gold smith.

For the Expaticans, they get an opportunity to meet each other, share items and possibly make some money! This group is for fun and it is not intended to be a commercial enterprise.

A great place to move those last few items you do not want to take on your next move. For big items - bring a photo please.

Expatica Café
Rue Francois Gay 152
Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
1150 Brussels
[masked]

Chalks Corriette
GSM:[masked]
Email: [masked]

Visiting us;
There is some good street parking; and we can also be reached by Metro (Tomberg and Montgomery) or Tram (39 and 44).

From Tomberg metro; walk down Avenue Henri Pauwels. This runs into Avenue Val d’Or and we are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.

From Montgomery metro; walk up Avenue Tervuren away from Cinquantenaire. On your right will be Woluwe Park, on your left you shall see Avenue Val d’Or. Walk along Val d’Or. We are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.

Or, take the tram from Montgomery (39 or 44), or if you are coming from the other direction of Tervuren (44) and Wezembeek (39), get off at stop Chien Vert or Jules Ceasar. Walk up Avenue Val d’Or. We are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.
name: Our First Swap Shop meeting of 2010

Berthe Tanwo Njole aka D-WA, is a young artist native from Cameroon. She began to sing at the age of 10. Live Music at the Expatica Cafe – Jeno Balazs (Hungarian violinist) Andy Smeets (Piano)

Thursday 4 March 2010 – 20h00 to 22h00

Jeno was born in Budapest and arrived in Belgium to study at the music academy of Antwerp. At the age of 18 he played with a Mexican Mariachis group. Later he joined the Gypsy Jazz orchestra of the Grand Mayeur, place du Grand Sablon in Brussels.

Andy Smeets will accompany Jeno at the piano. Andy grew up being exposed to both music and art, studying both classical piano and church organ. Although he chose a career in teaching and educational science, music always played a major role in his life. Andy taught music and art at elementary school level, performed with bands and choirs as well as solo, written two 2 musicals for children, and gives piano classes. When he moved to Belgium, Andy took up jazz piano studies. He is also the musical director for the Expatica Café in Brussels.

description:
Meet the Expert - A workshop at the Expatica Café, Brussels.

Monday 15 March 2010 – 19h00 to 21h00
Join us for a learning workshop at the Expatica café. This concept allows Expatica to bring to our community a number of experts that offer interesting subjects to stimulate us, introduce us to new ways of looking at things, and provide an opportunity to get answers to some old questions.
Below, you will find information about the workshop, the workshop leader, together with location information, joining instructions and any participation fees (most sessions are free).
The subject of this interactive workshop is:

Access your creative brain, and help your team members access theirs.

The Expert and workshop leader: Serge Pegoff

Summary of the workshop:

Serge has helped more than 60 management teams to increase their effectiveness with difficult business challenges by improving their creativity and alignment.

But in his early career, he had not always been a creative team member: as an Associate Director in a management consulting company, he was almost fired after criticizing stupidly, in a strategy task force, senior managers of the firm.

When he heard about this, he decided to invest in these questions: “How could he help himself to be more creative in a team? How could he help his team members to be more creative?” So he began 15 years ago to study brain and mind behaviour and to apply what he learned first to himself and then to his client teams.

So in this workshop, Serge will share with you what he learned and give you the opportunity to practice accessing your creativity:

1. How do we make creative decisions based on the latest brain research?
You will understand why we have difficulty to access our creative brain and what the warning signals are.

2. What are the access doors to the creative brain?
You will get easy to follow resources to access more often the creative part of your brain.

3. How can I help my team become more creative & aligned?
You will learn proven approaches to develop team behaviours which unleash team creativity. And you will get the opportunity to practice powerful creativity team techniques.

About the expert
Serge Pegoff is an independent coach helping senior and middle managers to evolve their behaviors to successfully handle new challenges. Serge has coached more than 40 senior and middle managers and more than 60 business teams in the following organizations: Fortis Bank, AXA, CIC Group, Suez, Bayer, Electrabel, AG Insurance, Belgacom, Cisco, KPN (Netherlands), Swisscom, Carrefour, Guiness, GlaxoSmithKline.…

Serge is an accredited Associate Member from the SFCoach (“Société Française de Coaching”) and an Action Learning Coach from the WIAL (World Institute for Action Learning). Serge has created and led the Change Management practices at Arthur D. Little and KPMG (Brussels) and has an MBA from Insead (France).

description:
Scotch Whisky Master Class – Expatica Café

Workshop Leader - Malcolm J. Andrews
Friday 26 March 2010 – 20h00 to 22h30
35.00 per person – Registration is mandatory (16 Places)

Expatica Café
Rue Francois Gay 152
1150 Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
Brussels

Chalks Corriette
Tel:[masked]
Fax:[masked]
Cell:[masked]
Email: [masked]
Media Partner; www.expatica.be
Location Management; www.redinvest.be

Why you should attend a Malcolm Andrews Scotch Whisky Master Class?
Many people, anxious to know more about whisky, will have already attended a Malcolm Andrews Whisky “Nosing & Tasting”. Among such fans, much interest has been shown in going further in their quest for knowledge. A “Master Class” is designed for devotees who wish to understand the whisky production process (in various countries), the criteria of age and quality, the maturing process, vatting techniques, how blended whisky is made and what do the Scots call “pure malt”?

Participants will experience the nosing and tasting techniques used by the Master Blenders, as well as the physical changes of adding water to whisky. Seven carefully selected whiskies of different types will be presented and tasted together with expert technical guidance on how to choose one’s preferred type and region of production.

Whisky expert Malcolm J. Andrews covers all this and more in his Whisky Master Class. The subject is complex but the pleasure of knowing what whisky to choose and how to treat it is more than worth two hours of study, analysis and, yes, pleasure! And the fact that Malcolm is not only a knowledgeable but a highly entertaining speaker - is good reason why you should join us.
Malcolm Andrews was born to a Scottish mother; during his childhood he played around a distillery so the reek of malting barley penetrated his soul. His whisky background is impressive. He affected market research for whisky producers to determine the strength of the Benelux market. He was appointed “Outside Whisky Ambassador” by the world’s largest producer and has technically trained hundreds of staff in stores and supermarkets. The press refers to him as “Scotland’s Continental Whisky Ambassador” and his work takes him all over Europe presenting whisky in three different languages.

The subject of this interactive workshop is:

Law of Attraction - Discussion Group

The Expert and workshop leader: Natasha Abudarham

Description of workshop:
The Law of Attraction is a very powerful law that is at work every single day whether you believe it or not. Quite simply, you will attract the people, the places, the circumstances and the events into your life that match your state of being. This means that whatever you have or don’t have in your life is a direct reflection of how you think, behave and act, often on a subconscious level. By learning how to use law of attraction to your advantage, you will go beyond what you perceive is possible to really allow a positive flow of happiness, abundance and prosperity into your life. Whether you are new to Law of Attraction and want to find out more or you already practice LOA, come and join us every month to discuss new tips, tricks, tools and techniques to attract a life you love, meet new people and have some fun!

description:
Meet the Expert – Setting up your own business in Belgium

A workshop at the Expatica Café – Brussels;

Thursday 20 May 2010 - 19h00 to 21h15

Join us for a networking and learning event at the Expatica café. This is an opportunity to learn from experts, about how to set-up a business, NGO or trade association in Belgium.

The Experts are:
Louise Hilditch and Julie Kolokotsa

Summary of the Local Knowledge Guide, their consultancy services and who they are

About the book:
In only one hundred pages, the Local Knowledge Guide to setting up and running your business in Belgium contains all the essential information that you need to set up a new business in Belgium. Whether you are opening a representation office or starting your own business, this invaluable guide sets out clearly the key issues you need to work out before you start, making sure that you don't waste any time or money. It is packed full of tips, checklists and 'bottom lines' so you won't forget anything or make an expensive administrative error.

The book has the great virtue of being concise while containing all the key information required. The layout guides the reader in an easy-to-follow format through the complex maze of Belgian requirements.

It is indispensable if you are setting up a representation office for local government, a trade association, an NGO or your own business.

About the authors:
Louise Hilditch came to Belgium from the UK in 1993 and after working for a number of years in the European Parliament, went on to work for a major multinational food corporation as a lobbyist before leaving to co-found a successful public affairs consultancy with Julie Kolokotsa. She has since set up and managed several not-for-profit organisations in Belgium and elsewhere in the EU. She now advises businesses, not-for-profit organisations and foundations on how to set up and run successful ventures in Belgium.

Julie Kolokotsa came to Belgium from the US in 1991 and after working for several years in the European Parliament co-founded a successful public affairs and event management consultancy. She has worked for an impressive number of blue chip companies over the past 15 years and her latest venture is aimed at advising other small businesses on how to succeed.

The book will be on sale at the event at a discounted rate of €20.00.

This workshop has 20 available places – reserve early to avoid disappointment.
Participation Fees; 20.00 per person: This covers a children’s charity donation, administration, snacks and a drink.

description:
Expatica Communications – “i am not a tourist” Community fair for internationals living and working in Belgium. Sunday 6 June 10h00 to 18h00 – Cinquantenaire.

Details can be found at http://www.expatica.c...

Sunday 6 June - Experience our "i am not a tourist" Fair in Brussels. This is Expatica´s Community fair for internationals and expatriates living and working in Belgium. Mark it down in your calendar and visit us at Espace53 (Autoworld Museum), Cinquantenaire - Brussels. Bring your family and friends for a fun day out.

The "i am not a tourist" Fair will have a range of valuable resources from previous European fairs, but with extra attention given to community related resources for the experienced expat. Those of you who already have your bearings in Belgium can therefore enjoy as many of the features as the newcomers; including food and drink, entertainment, local clubs and workshops. A number of artists and photographers, Belgian and international, will also be exhibiting their work.

So even if you have lived in Belgium for some time already, do come to our fair to discover what's going on in the rest of the expat community and learn more about your adopted country. Our fair is all about enriching your life abroad, whether you are new to the expat lifestyle or an experienced hand!
Regarding those practical necessities, for those new to Belgium and in need of information, our fair will supply a selection of the best resources this country has to offer. The "i am not a tourist" Fair brings a broad range of companies and agencies who specialise in expatriate services together under one roof. From banks, investment firms and insurance companies to schools, local clubs and tax agencies, all have their place at our community fair. The stand holders are there to help you with house and job hunting, immigration and permits, staying long term, starting your own business, having fun and more.

Whether you've lived in Belgium for 5 months, 5 years or even if you haven't yet made the move, you will surely find something of interest to you.

The "i am not a tourist" Fair gives you access to the international community, be it through individuals, groups, clubs, or businesses.

These one-day fairs present a wealth of information and resources to boost your life abroad. So order your free ticket or download a poster and join us on Sunday 6 June for what has become an expat institution. One e-ticket holder will be randomly selected during the fair as the winner of a dinner for two at the Expatica Café. Be sure to join us at the fair and see if you are the lucky one!

[masked]
[masked]
name: Expatica Community Fair

description:
Tuesday 29 June 2010 – 19h00 to 21h30

Join us for a learning workshop at the Expatica café. This concept allows Expatica to bring to our community a number of experts that offer interesting subjects to stimulate us, introduce us to new ways of looking at things, and provide an opportunity to get answers to some old questions.
Below, you will find information about the workshop, the workshop leader, together with location information, joining instructions and any participation fees.

The subject of this interactive workshop is:

Law of Attraction - Monthly Discussion Group: This session will focus on - 7 Steps to attracting long lasting loving relationships.

The Expert and workshop leader: Natasha Abudarham

Natasha Abudarham
The 'Go Get It' Life Change Specialist
Emotional Freedom Techniques Practitioner & Trainer
Tel: [masked]
Website: www.natashaabudarham.com

Description of workshop:
The Law of Attraction is a very powerful law that is at work every single day whether you believe it or not. Quite simply, you will attract the people, the places, the circumstances and the events into your life that match your state of being.

This means that whatever you have or don’t have in your life is a direct reflection of how you think, behave and act, often on a subconscious level. By learning how to use law of attraction to your advantage, you will go beyond what you perceive is possible to really allow a positive flow of happiness, abundance and prosperity into your life.

Whether you are new to Law of Attraction and want to find out more or you already practice LOA, come and join us every month to discuss new tips, tricks, tools and techniques to attract a life you love, meet new people and have some fun!

This workshop has 18 available places – reserve early to avoid disappointment.
Fees; 20.00 per person. This covers speakers fee, a donation to our children’s charity, administration, snacks and a drink.

description:
Social Networking at La Terrasse - Brussels

Friday 9 July 19h00 to late

Expatica social networking is an informal get-together, where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, meet members of the Expatica team and enjoy the vibrant trendy atmosphere and music of La Terrasse. This location is almost completely outside, so do pay attention to the weather to be sure you are dressed to thrill and appropriately!

For those of you coming to La Terrasse for the first time, it is styled along the lines of the Niki Beach concept (Marbella), with water feature, exotic plants, cream furniture, lounge areas to sit and sand area’s with beach chairs to chill out on and enjoy an intimate conversation.
There are many bars and a restaurant at this location – to find our group, just look out for Chalks in the bright pink shirt!

La Terrasse de L’Hippodrome
(the old horse racing track)
Chasussee de la Hulpe 51-53
1180 Uccle

NOTE; The entrance is hidden at what should be number 49 on the chaussee – to the right of the Hippodrome as you face the main gates. There is a large car park once you enter the Terrasse gates and the 94 Tram stops directly outside the venue. We would encourage you to make the effort for this event – the location is cool and well worth a visit. We anticipate an Expatica crowd of around 200 people – there is no entry charge.

Join us for Charity evening at the Kam Club. There will be plenty of good music, and many ways for you contribute to the community groups that we support.

description:
NBIB Info-Fair 24 October 2010 - Espace53 (Autoworld Museum), Brussels (Merode Metro)

A community development initiative - Unite, Discover, Network

About our Info-Fair Concept:
There are a number of larger community fairs in Belgium run by schools, community or commercial groups. These take a similar format and typically last a whole day, often run on a weekend. The past years have seen a decline in attendance at some of these events, which could be down to the changing face of business in Europe.

However, the needs of Expatriates and Internationals have not changed, possibly just the way they want to see those needs met or presented - this is the purpose of an Info-Fair. Rather than 1 or 2 big events each year, NBIB plans to host many smaller Info-Fairs, targeted by way of complimentary services and adding a bigger social and networking dimension. When away from home, the ability to meet new people is high on the list of needs; together with a need for services, products and tools.
At NBIB, our commitment to our community comes first; and our Info-Fair will have a small range of valuable resources from previous European fairs, with attention given to community related resources for the experienced expat.

Our first event in this new format:
• Sunday 24 October 2010, 14h00 to 17h00 – Autoworld Museum (Espace53 on the first floor, overlooking the treasures of the museum)
• Entrance is Free,
• Stand holders and visitors will be offered basic refreshments; tea, coffee, soft drinks and simple snacks,

Sponsorship:
At NBIB, our commitment to our community comes first. For this reason, we offer a very competitive price to stand holders, supported by visibility either in-print or on-line with our respected media partners. We also promote our events at International schools, businesses and locations where International people like to visit.

• The lead media partner is Expatica Communications www.expatica.com/be - supporting us with on-line banners and news letters. We shall also host online with Away Magazine http://www.awaymagazi.... Print ads will be placed in the Bulletin and Up Front magazine. Other media partnerships are under consideration.
• A poster will be circulated to all major locations where Expats and Internationals are part of the community, with a request to place this in a prominent place,
• Some of the profits from this event will be given to Europe’s Children Our Concern (ECOC) www.ecoc.be for their Children In Need 2010 Appeal.

Location:
Our first Info-Fair will be hosted at our partner location Espace53 (www.espace53.be), first floor, Autoworld Museum, Parc du Cinquantenaire 11, 1000 Brussels

Visiting Autoworld (http://www.autoworld....
There is parking for up to 600 cars and Metro stops Merode and Schuman are but a short walk away.

Please use Google Maps (http://maps.google.co...) to find the best way to get to us from where you are – either by private or public transport.

Contact
Networking Business In Belgium, &
Extraordinary Moments In Time
rue Francois Gay 152
1150 Brussels
Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
Belgium

Chalks Corriette
Managing Director

Tel:[masked]
Fax:[masked]
Cell/Mobile:[masked]

[masked]
http://www.nbib.biz...

description:
Announcing a new Meetup for Networking Business In Belgium (NBIB)!

What: Make the Law of attraction work for you

Price: EUR20.00 per person

Where: Expatica Cafe
rue Francois Gay 152
Sint-Pieters-Woluwe
[masked]

Make the Law of attraction work for you

Tuesday 5 October 2010 – 19h00 to 21h00

One52 (Expatica Café)
First floor meeting room
Rue Francois Gay 152
Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
1150 Brussels

Join us for a learning workshop. This concept allows Networking Business In Belgium, to bring to our community a number of experts who present interesting subjects to stimulate us, introduce us to new ways of looking at special needs children and provide an opportunity to get answers to some old questions. Below, you will find information about our next workshop, the workshop leader, together with location information and joining instructions.

The subject of this interactive workshop is:
Make the Law of attraction work for you

The Expert and workshop leader: Lydia Proschinger

Lydia Proschinger, Certified Life Coach, LOA Mindset & Health Expert,
Advanced EFT & Matrix Reimprinting Practitioner
Owner, Life Pro Coaching
Tel: +32 [masked]
Website: www.life-procoaching.com/blog

Description of workshop:

The workshop is held in 12 parts, each part building on the previous one – therefore it is best to sign up for all – even if you feel you are already more advanced and have a body of knowledge from reading books and following other seminars.

This seminar is geared towards people who would like to learn more about

- getting the crisis out of you’re mind and body
- understand quantum mechanics and the concept of T.I.M.E.
- understand electro magnetism and the concept of E.M.O.T.I.O.N.
- learn how to speed up the manifestation process
- creating the field for a clearer vision
- eliminating resistance and self-sabotage
- take continuous & constant action
- establish a mental routine & daily energy clearing
- allowing and detachment from outcome
- discover unconscious patterns re: relationships e.g. with partner / money
- creating new healthy patterns, habits, relationships
- practice of gratitude without platitudes
- consciously bringing JOY to enjoy your life
- practice L.O.V.E abundantly

A manual with interactive exercises will be made available to everybody at a cost of 15.00 and can be used to continue the LOA practice at home. If you come with questions and/or suggestions and prepared exercises, we can close in on specific issues you have.

This workshop has 16 available places – reserve early to avoid disappointment.
Participation Fee; 20.00 per person, per session: This covers: speaker’s fee, administration and snacks. Drinks can be purchased from the One52 bar.

Payment must be made in advance to secure your place. We offer a returns policy for all cancelations 48hrs before the event.

If you would prefer to make a bank transfer, here are the details
Centea;[masked]
IBAN; BE[masked]
BIC; SPAABE22
Refrence: LOA

Chalks Corriette
Tel:[masked]
Fax:[masked]
Cell:[masked]
Email: [masked]
Media Partner; www.expatica.com/be


Brought to you by:
Expatica – http://www.expatica.c...
Europe’s Children Our Concern (ECOC) – http://www.ecoc.be/en...
Community Help Service (CHS) - http://www.chsbelgium...
People to People International Europe - http://www.ptpe.org/...
Networking Business In Belgium – http://www.nbib.biz...

Visiting us;
There is some good street parking; and we can also be reached by Metro (Tomberg and Montgomery) or Tram (39 and 44).

From Tomberg metro; walk down Avenue Henri Pauwels. This runs into Avenue Val d’Or and we are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.

From Montgomery metro; walk up Avenue Tervuren away from Cinquantenaire. On your right will be Woluwe Park, on your left you shall see Avenue Val d’Or. Walk along Val d’Or. We are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.

Or, take the tram from Montgomery (39 or 44), or if you are coming from the other direction of Tervuren (44) and Wezembeek (39), get off at stop Chien Vert or Jules Ceasar. Walk up Avenue Val d’Or. We are on the corner at rue Francois Gay.

Please also use Google Maps (http://maps.google.co...) to find the best way to get to us from where you are – either by private or public transport.

For more options, please call Chalks[masked]

description:
After-work Networking for Belgium’s Children In Need 2010 Appeal

Friday 19 November – 18h00

Join us for an extraordinary networking event and contribute to a fantastic cause. Internationals and Locals alike will join the ECOC (Europe’s Children Our Concern) team to celebrate and raise money for children and young people in Belgium. This event runs each year and offers help to those children finding education complex due to issues of Dyslexia, ADHD, Autism – or they simply have a creative learning style.

Doors open at 18h00 with food, drinks, tombola, auction and entertainment running through to 03h00.

This appeal is founded on the premise that every child and young person in Belgium, regardless of race, gender, income, geography or learning ability; should be supported to realise their full potential in main stream education.

“The only true disability is a crushed spirit” Aimee Mulins

Le Chatelain All Suite Hotel
Rue du Chatelain 17
1050 Brussels

Tel:[masked]
www.le-chatelain.net
[masked]

Expatica and Lily La Tigresse look forward to seeing you and your friends at one of our weekly parties. Our mission is to offer great parties, good prices and top service.

Saturday 20 November – Doors open at 22h00 – 5.00 Euro entrance

Nexx Club
(Formerly the Guru Bar)
8, chaussée de Boondael
1050 Bruxelles

Cocktail prices are reduced to ensure you have a great night and money in your pocket for the taxi home!

To benefit from reductions at our events, you will need to register with us at the door, and we shall give you a free Lily card. Our events take place at a number of key locations in Brussels, giving our community a chance to experience Brussels. Our 5000 strong community consists of both international and local people.

Your hosts are: Xavier van Dooren (Lily La Tigresse) and Chalks Corriette (Expatica)

Media partner: Expatica Communications www.expatica.com/be

description:
WINE SENSATION

(A)WAY & WINERY PRESENT

WINE TASTING EXPAT PARTY to celebrate (A)WAY’s 5th anniversary and discover 30 wines from across Europe

Come and meet other expats that share your passion for good food and wine, discover the new Winery bar and have a few bottles delivered to your place!

The wine tasting event will take place in the newly opened Winery bar, in the European district right next to Schuman. The shop has a wide choice of wines from France and other European countries, which you will be able to taste during the evening along with some delicious tapas. Would you like to bring a few bottles home? The sommelier will help you choose, whilst respecting your palate and budget, and even deliver your order for free within Brussels area.

While you’re there, meet the (A)WAY production team and discover in exclusivity our Christmas Special issue. Plethora of gifts and surprises are waiting for you along with great offers on wine. The event shall be featured in the next issue of your favorite magazine!

WHEN: Thursday 9 December
TIME: 5.00 pm till 9.00 pm
WHERE: Winery Schuman
Rue Juste Lipse, 17 (former rue de la Verveine),
1040 Brussels
www.wineryonline.be

PRICE: Free entrance, but registration is necessary,
please click here: http://r20.rs6.net/tn...

Gifts for everyone, tombola and special conditions on bottles of wine.
name: Wine Sensation with Away Magazine

Foreign Affairs:

www.foreignaffairsband.eu

Next gig : Thu. 20/01/11 at 20.30 at the Winenot restaurant/bar in Tervuren
Brusselsesteenweg 71. 3080 Tervuren.

Tram 44 to Tervuren station – 10 minute walk to town center.
www.winenot.be

The music reflects our different ages,
backgrounds and musical tastes.
It includes a variety of styles
and covers five decades!
There is something for everyone!
Bring your dancing shoes!

Foreign Affairs was formed in early 2007.
We are Foreign because the band members
are of six different nationalities.
The Affairs makes us sound exciting
– which we are!!
Foreign Affairs are:

Sharon Norton (vocals)
Lise Floris (vocals)
Dave Skinner (guitar, saxophones,
mandolin, harmonica, vocals)
Barrie Williams (guitar)
Pekka Jarvilehto (bass guitar, guitar)
Sander Villers (drums)

description:
Singles Café – information in EN, NL and FR:  A truly international evening where people can meet, chat, have a drink with the singles community.

 

Singles Café: EN

Join us together with other locals and Internationals living and/or working in Belgium for a relaxed evening with our singles community.  We are a group of people looking to meet others in a similar situation to have some fun and good company. We meet over a drink in a relaxed environment in a number of locations. Our core support team will help with introductions, should that be useful.

 

When : 30 April at 19h00

Address :Wezem-Break Clubhouse

Avenue Astridlaan 85

1970 Wezembeek-Oppem

Info:[masked] (Anne) or [masked]

 

Singles Café: NL

Een gezellig avondje-uit samen met onze groep, lokale singles en buitenlanders die in België wonen en/of werken.  Wij kijken ernaar uit  om samen met onze groep,  singles en vrienden te ontmoeten tijdens een avondje-uit  in een fijn gezelschap. 

Wij ontmoeten elkaar in een gezellig café of andere plaats in verschillende locaties.  Ons team zal je verwelkomen en indien je dat wenst, je voorstellen aan de groep.

 

Wanneer : 30 april om 9u.

Adres : Wezem-Break Clubhouse

Avenue Astridlaan 85

1970 Wezembeek-Oppem

Info:[masked] (Anne) or [masked]

 

 

Singles Café: FR

 Une soirée sympa avec notre communauté, des célibataires de la région, des amis  et des xpats qui travaillent et/ou habitent à Belgique.  Nous serions ravis de vous rencontrer, de rencontrer des nouveaux amis et célibataires pendant une  soirée agréable dans une ambiance et compagnie conviviale.

Ces soirées se dérouleront dans un café sympa ou différents  endroits.  Si vous le désirez, notre team vous accueillera et vous présentera à notre groupe et les autres nouveaux venus.

 

Quand : 30 Avril à 19h00

Adresse : Wezem-Break Clubhouse

Avenue Astridlaan 85

1970 Wezembeek-Oppem

Info:[masked] (Anne) or [masked]

description:
Speed Dating with Lily La Tigresse

Thursday 12 May -19h00 – 23h00

La Place
Place du Châtelain 33
1040 Brussels,
Belgium

Xavier and Chalks present another Speed Dating event by Lily la Tigresse.
We offer a special group for the International community in English, in addition to the already popular French speaking group.

Friendly, fun and relaxed, Speed Dating can help you to widen your circle of friends and find a potential partner. The dating sessions take place at 19h00 and 21h00 and are subject to the number of people participating.

The principle is simple: (At least) 7 men, 7 women and 7 minutes to exchange information and to get a feel for a connection with the other person.

After every encounter, the participants will indicate on a form if they wish to meet one of the people they have just met. Where there is a match, the organizers will connect both people by email, phone or private Facebook message (according to your preferences) no more than 2 days after the event. All contact is discreet and respectful.

The full process will be explained to you when you arrive at the event. There is an opportunity to relax over a drink with your group once the formal part of the evening is over.

For fees, additional information and to reserve your place, please do
SMS or call Xavier[masked]
Or, should you have more questions
email [masked]  

http://www.brussels4you.eu/speed_dating_.html
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

One of the things people ask us about Brussels, is where to find great activities for singles.

 

Singles' Nights offer a great opportunity for people interested in meeting a variety of like-minded individuals to make new friends. One additional bonus about single people is the fact that they often also have single friends.

 

The trendy setting of the Wxyz bar at the Aloft Brussels Hotel, as part of their after-work concept, is great place to cast your net wider into the cosmopolitan community of Brussels. Do join us for drinks, snacks and dancing each Thursday from 18h00 until late.

description:
Hi :-)

we'll be in Brussels the second weekend of November and we'd like a lot to meet you all, very nice people living in Brussels!!

We are Italian, from Rome, and we have never been in Brussels, so it will be very interesting to socialize and discover the city.

Le Gran Cafe looks like a cozy place, easy to reach, where hopefully we can meet up, have a chat over a drink or something to eat...

We'll be there looking forward to seeing you on Saturday the 12th November from h.7 pm.

Your friends are very welcome too.

Vous etes tous les bienvenus!!

All the best,

Loredana and Gabriella :-)

description:
Europe’s Children Our Concern asbl
Supporting children and young people with learning difficulties
  Together with:

People to People International (PTPI) Youth
friendship through educational, cultural and humanitarian activities 

 And:

Serve The City (STC) Brussels
Serve the Citymobilizes volunteers to show kindness in practical ways to people in need
 

Children In Need (Belgium) - Appeal Event

Saturday 19 November (18h00 to 23h45) 2011

Aloft Brussels Hotel - Schuman

Place Jean Rey, 1040 Brussels

Tel:[masked]

www.aloftbrussels.com

We work so that every child and young person in Belgium with a learning difficulty - regardless of race, gender, income or geography - can be supported to realize their full potential in mainstream education.

“The only true disability is a crushed spirit” Aimee Mullins

About the appeal event – we encourage you to get involved:

FREE entrance, with food and drinks on sale An early start allows for schools, youth clubs and families to participate Local and international bands, schools, clubs and other fun activities will provide entertainment A Tombola will be run on the night In the run up to the event our community is encouraged to run fund-raising events and we shall publish their efforts on the night Do tell your friends and colleagues about the Children In Need (Belgium) event NOTE: it is important to stress that the funds raised will stay in Belgium and be used to fund Belgian-based projects About ECOC

ECOC is a voluntary organization and registered charity, founded in 1993 in Brussels.  It is run by a core group of volunteers www.ecoc.be.

About PTPI

PTPI was established on September 11, 1956, by President Dwight D. Eisenhower. After he left the office of President in 1961, he arranged to have the organization privatized as a non-governmental organization. The Global HQ is located in Kansas City Missouri, the European HQ is in Berlin and the Belgian office is registered in Brussels.

About STC

STC is a movement of volunteers serving cities in practical ways & inspiring people to be givers in this world. We believe that many people doing small things together can make a big difference in our world.

Making a donation

Here are the ways to make a donation:

Credit card or PayPal donations can be made via the link below www.ecoc.be(reference Appeal)  Donations can also be made directly into the ECOC bank account - ING[masked]; IBAN : BE[masked]; BIC : BBRUBEBB (reference Appeal) At the ECOC Office or during the many hosted networking events and workshops. Governance:As a registered charity, ECOC/PTPI have in place a structure for ensuring that all resources are allocated. Financial and project reports are posted on our website to ensure transparency, and annual public meetings are held every June to allow for questions and answers. Regular e-news letters are delivered and weekly updates are made to our website.

Chemin au Bois 40, 1970 Wezembeek-Oppem, Belgium

Mobile;[masked] (Chalks)

e-mail [masked]

website www.ecoc.be

 

http://brussels4you.eu/children_in_need_.html

name: Attitude - our monthly get together for fun

description:
4 March – Come walk with us; join Sarah and the People to People community for a two-hour walk on Sunday 4 March. Meeting point - at the Porte de Hal - the gateway facing Rue Haute – 13h45 for 14h00 start.


This two-hour walk will take us from the last vestige of the 2nd city rampart through the ever busy and picturesque Marolles district, the very heart of the medieval city. This is a walk through time, and although there are definite signs of the 21st century along the way, the Marolles proudly retain their old world charm. As we go along the Rue Haute, an ancient thoroughfare with its colourful history and vibrant personalities, you will discover that each century has left its mark on this fascinating area. The walk ends in the Grand Sablon, a square known for its smart cafés, restaurants and shops.


Please do register for this free event.
We have 16 places available.
[masked] 
[masked]

description:
Disco for Malawi

Brussels, Friday, 9 March

Serve the City (STC) invite you to join us for an evening of music and fun. Boogie on down to sounds from the 70s, 80s and 90s – at the same time raise money for the STC Splash project. Fresh water is something we rarely think about. Many communities dream about having fresh water and STC are going to deliver 1000 euro to dig a well for a community in Malawi.

Serve the City is a movement of volunteers around the world connecting with local opportunities to serve in our cities.

The evening kicks off at 21h00 and entrance is just 5.00 euro per person.

Roosters
Grétrystraat
1000 Brussels

http://www.servethecity.be/brussels/ 
[masked] 
[masked]

Partners: Roosters, DJ Dirk Huybrechts, People to People International.

description:
Social Media Clinic

Tuesday 20 March, 19h00 to 20h30 @Aloft Hotel, Schuman

Participation is free and the workshop is limited to 8 participants.

For many people, the issues of social media seem just as confusing today as they were when social media became the buzz phrase. How do you get more fans on Facebook? What’s Twitter all about? Is your organization working to get a key message out, and you sense there are things that you could do better?

People to People International are sponsoring a clinic for our community to discuss your social media challenges. The workshop leader is Duncan Malcolm - he has worked in the online world since 2007. During this time Duncan has helped agencies, blue chips and startups. Some of the better-known brands are TUI Travel, Dr Martens, Liz Earle, Save the Children, Ipsos and Nielsen.

description:
Brussels, Belgium 25 March 2012

 

PTPI Belgium is pleased to invite you for a Tervuren Park walk.

Sunday 25 March 14h00 to 16h00 – 16 places available.

Participation is free.

Beginning at the elephant statue opposite the Museum of Central Africa, we shall stroll around the magnificent grounds of Tervuren Park and discover Belgium's colonial past, the 19th c "school of Tervuren" art movement and the colourful history of its vanished ducal palace. We shall stop for drinks and conversation at the end of the walk.

Tram 44 is the final stop in Tervuren and the meeting point is a short walk from there.  You will also find ample parking either at the tram stop, or at the actual meeting point. The Belgian public transport system is efficient and cost effective.  You can check out tram time’s at the STIB link here> http://www.stib.be/index.htm?l=en

The address for the Museum is:

RMCA

Leuvensesteenweg 13

3080 Tervuren - Belgium

[masked]

Website link here> http://www.africamuseum.be/home?set_language=en&cl=en

 

The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting pot of cultures, businesses and

associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, and whilst we are not charging for the event, we do appreciate voluntary donations made directly into our bank account.

Should you feel moved to make a contribution, you will find the details at this link> http://www.ptpi.be/index.php?article_id=9

For anyone reading this material outside of the Meetup.com environment, you can find the event registration tool here> http://www.meetup.com/socialNIB/

Thank you for your support

Chalks Corriette – President

People to People International Belgium asbl

[masked]

www.ptpi.be

description:
Just for the fun of it, come and join us for beer, beer and more beer.

The Golden Boot on the Grand'Place is a fantastic location to meet, eat, drink and watch the world of Brussels go by.  This is a very Belgian cafe, built in 1697, known in French as La Chaloupe d'Or. Come and make new friends, share your friends and enjoy some time with a group of Internationals living and working in Belgium.

The menu is limited, and as you would expect in Belgium, the food is very good.

Pay as you go format.

See you there

Chalks Corriette

President - People to People International

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

description:
Go Argentinian – and raise money for our humanitarian community

People to People International invite you to join us at the fabulous Music Corner, close to Place Jourdan, on Saturday 12 May from 19h30.

There will be Empanadas (a typical Argentinian dish) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empanada, Argentinian wines, and live music. No entrance fee – pay for food to consume at the Music Corner and wine by the bottle to enjoy at home. Do join us for much fun, great company and culture, and at the same time - raise money that will be used to support a number of our humanitarian projects running in Belgium.

Music Corner – Piano Bar
Rue Froissart 43
1040 Etterbeek
Brussels

The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

name: Attitude - back to basics

description:
Join us and others from the People to People and Serve the City network to host a street party at the Jeu du Balle.  The idea is that we shall be setting up from 15h00 (after helping to clean up the area), starting the BBQ around 17h00 and we have invited the many volunteers and people we serve to come and join us for food, drink, music and fun.

Please do come and join us - the event is free and to be clear, the food and drinks are mainly for the people from the charities.  We will share what we can with everyone else.  To be safe, please do bring a little snack and drink for your self and your friends.

I would encourage you to come and support us as we celebrate a week-long program of community projects in Brussels. We have had the most brilliant time and people have shared the most complex part of their lives with us. We are expecting around 500 people for the street party - so it should be lots of fun. All entertainment will be provided by local street artists and friends that are musical.

Please do connect with me should you have any questions at all, would like to help or feel a little unsure as to what to expect.

Regards

Chalks

[masked]

[masked]

http://www.servethecity.be/brussels/
how_to_find_us: Chalks will be wearing a Red Tee-shirt with his name on it........

description:
Friday 24 August – Doors open at 22h00

La Place 33D, Place du Châtelain, 1050 Bruxelles.
https://www.facebook.com/pages/La-Place-Art-Bar/245467918800440

This concept brings together local and international people to have fun, at a number of trendy locations in Brussels.

Weekly events offer our community:
A competitive registration/entrance fee,
Key locations in Brussels for a change in scenery,
Regular events to support the active agenda’s of our community,
The place for Belgian and International people to connect,
A fantastic range of music offered by each host location, and,
A welcome drink or discounted cocktails according the location rules.

Our events take place at a number of key locations in Brussels, giving our community a chance to experience Brussels. Our strong network consists of both international and local people.

We look forward to seeing you and your friends at one of our weekly events. Our mission is to offer great parties, good prices and top service.

name: Attitude - back to basics

description:
11 September – Come walk with us; join Sarah and the People to People community for a two-hour walk on Tuesday 11 September. Meeting point - at the Porte de Hal - the gateway facing Rue Haute – 09h45 for a 10h00 start.


This two-hour walk will take us from the last vestige of the 2nd city rampart through the ever busy and picturesque Marolles district, the very heart of the medieval city. This is a walk through time, and although there are definite signs of the 21st century along the way, the Marolles proudly retain their old world charm. As we go along the Rue Haute, an ancient thoroughfare with its colourful history and vibrant personalities, you will discover that each century has left its mark on this fascinating area. The walk ends in the Grand Sablon, a square known for its smart cafés, restaurants and shops.


Please do register for this free event.
We have 16 places available.
[masked] 
[masked]

There is a public parking facility at the Port de Hal and good public transport connections. If you need addtional information about the meeting point, please do call Chalks for support.

www.ptpi.be

We are not charging for this event.  However, we would welcome any voluntary financial donations, no matter how small, directly into our bank account.  The funds allow us to continue our work and support our growing community here in Belgium.

Bank account:[masked]
IBAN: BE[masked]
BIC: BBRUBEBB

ASBL/NGO registration number:[masked]

Thank you for your support - we at PTPI do very much appreciate it.
