People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

description:
Self–Compassion – a tool to deal with life’s challenging moments - October 21st 10:00 to 17:30

Do you ever get stressed, over-reactive, or frustrated when faced with difficult moments and assume that there must be a better way to handle things?Well, there is – its called self-compassion., and it REALLY WORKS!! Come along and find out more ….

Self-compassion draws on research from contemporary psychology together with wisdom from ancient traditions to provide a set of simple tools to help you through life’s challenging and stressful moments, with more grace, ease and sense of balance.

During the workshop you will learn the core components of self-compassion, find out why it works and how it can help you deal with stress in your life.

Using experiential exercises, you will learn simple tools so that you can transform your relationship to stress; find more kindness for yourself and others in challenging moments, and better appreciate the good moments in life. These tools can help transform moments of stress and challenge into productive and enriching times.

Ruth Friedman is a trainer, workshop leader, and guide. She works in the fields of anti-discrimination, intercultural and religious diversity, personal and careers development. She works with groups in diverse settings as well as with individuals. She has been running workshops since 1999.

For bookings please contact me at [masked] or on[masked]

The workshop takes place here:

La Sagesse Interieure

Rue General Lemans 32

1040 Bruxelles

(Close to Place Jourdain)

The normal cost of the workshop is 70 Euro

Donations will be accepted at this stage for the last few places.
how_to_find_us: Close to Place Jourdain
name: Self–Compassion Workshop

description:
Join us on Tuesday, 23 October at Bouche-à-Oreille theater, from 19.00 onwards for a stand-up comedy show in English performed by 4 professional comedians starring Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) and Dave Thompson (UK) & two comedians from Canada and Holland - Joe Eagan and Jeroen Pater. 

Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) is one of the biggest names in comedy in Belgian and Holland and sells out theatres and venues across the country with his one-man shows. Don't miss this chance to see this comedy superstar. 

Dave Thompson (UK) has performed comedy for over 20 years and TV programmes such as ‘Harry Hill’s TV Burp’, and ‘The Sketch Show’ have commissioned Dave as a writer. Dave is best known as the person inside the Tinky Winky costume in ‘Teletubbies’, which is still shown all over the world. 

Jeroen Pater (HOLL) is one of the foremost names in Dutch comedy and a godfather of the Utrecht comedy scene. Observational and twisted humour at its finest - he is a bit of a communications skills expert and we're looking forward to the magic he can work on the audience tonight. 

Joe Eagan (CANADA) currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. He regularly tours throughout Benelux and Germany and talks about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss. He will be the host for the evening. 

When: Tues, Oct 23. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00 
Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map:http://goo.gl/maps/Kjbzn)


Advance tickets are 20 euros and can be bought via: https://ticketlib.com/1d19f6fa598e0fb
Only 100 advance tickets are available.


Entry at the door is 25 euros from 19.00 onwards on the date (80 door tickets will be available on oct 23 from 19.00 onwards).

Note: The entire show will be in English.

Facebook event here: https://www.facebook.com/events/215783735218006/

description:
Monsters of the world, Wake up and hear this call to arms!

For centuries our species have been competing to be the most frightening in the eyes of our food, our neighbors - the humans. But this has changed! We have been slumbering where in the meantime a grotesque little buzzy creature called the Mosquitus Malarius has been ravaging the world; damaging our reputation. The Board of Monsters is in total disarray.


It is time for us to fight back and get rid of this little annoyance that has put our name to shame!
Get out of your graveyard or any other whereabouts! Prepare your fangs and claws! Wear your bloodiest clothes and join the monster convention this Halloween in Brussels.
Participate in our dashing catwalk, attend our rituals of replenishment and let your voice be heard!
This Halloween is ours and the perfect time to remind humans and mosquito's alike, that we monsters rule the night!


"Monsters should be scary not mosquitos!"


Details:
This year, the monsters unite to fight a common foo, the Mosquitus Malarius. Malaria is a disease caused by the blood parasite Plasmodium, which is transmitted by mosquitoes. Malaria causes 200 million illnesses per year and kills 600,000 people - mostly children under the age of five.
This has to be stopped! We monsters cannot tolerate such devastation and that is why we ask to wake the monster in you and join our convention. The Board of Monsters decided to support the project Nothing But Nets to fight back Malaria.


Benefits of the night will be donated to Nothing But Nets and to measure the impact of our shared actions, you may closely follow the status of donations at www.globalproblems-globalsolutions.org. We also invite you to do a personal donation through the same link.


If you don't succeed into awakening the monster within you (meaning you don't have a disguise), we can help you by providing you with amazing maskers or terrifying face paints at the price of €5.
During the event we will organize a catwalk for the most amazing monsters. Registrations will be at the event and the catwalk will take place at 23h30.

Autoworld

Parc du Cinquantenaire

1000, Bruxelles


Doors open at 21h00
https://www.facebook.com/events/274576269328934/

The entrance price for the party is €10 or €8 presales. 
Buy your presales tickets here: http://jcithoe.fikket.com/

description:
Scouts Fireworks 10 November 2012

First Brussels British Scouts and First Waterloo International Scouts invite all members of the community to their Fireworks night.

Saturday 10 November

British School of Brussels (BSB)

Leuvensesteenweg 19

3080 Tervuren

(Tram 44 – Montgomery to Tervuren tram station, which is the last stop.  BSB is a short walk, next to the African Museum)

 

Gates open at 18h00 and the Fireworks show starts at 19h00.

There will be food, drinks and live music.

Ticket prices: Adults 7 euro – Children (5 to 15 years) 5 euro.

The profits support the great work that the scouting community does in Belgium.

 

With sponsorship from: BSB, Volvo, Makeyour-point, Massmechelen Village and People to People International.

http://www.1stbrussels.be/2010/01/british-scout-groups-in-belgium/

For additional information please call our help-desk[masked] or email [masked]

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

description:
SOCIALize! the sociable and social thing to do

It's a new after-work idea - all the things you’d expect are there: good food and drinks, fine company and a great venue for relaxation. Four respected partners from the Brussels scene have got together to organize regular events but this time some of your entertainment budget automatically goes towards those less fortunate in the local community.

FREE Entrance, drink cards for 10€
3 course dinner for ONLY 20€ (please book in advance at [masked])

Come and join our first event, in which you'll be introduced to this new idea. You can join for a drink, for a meal, for the party, or for the three of them ! It's up to you.

- 18h30 doors open and you can just come for an afterwork drink
- 19h30: a multiple choice 3 course menu will be offered to you for 20€ (drinks not included)
- around 22h30, DJ Periklis will set fire to the dancefloor

Entrance is free, and drink cards will be sold at the door for the price of 10€. 

If you wish to attend the dinner, please send us an email at [masked]

We reduced the price of the menu from 25 to 20€, so that you get the best for less. Since we also care for charity work, maybe you can spare this extra 5€ reduction in order to help us. But once again, it's up to you.

About SOCIALize!
Four respected partners from the Brussels scene have got together to organize different categories of Events, with the aim of raising everyone’s interest, as well as raising funds to help those less fortunate in the local community.

More info on the Socialize! facebook page https://www.facebook.com/SOCIALize.be

Please remember: if you wish to attend the dinner, please send us an email at [masked]


Autoworld
Parc du Cinquantenaire 11
1000 Bruxelles
(Merode Metro)

Friday 23 November – 18h30 till late
Wine and dine, DJ and dancing
No entrance fee!

Powered by Expatrium:
In partnership with: Interactive Expats Brussels, Junior Chamber International (JCI) and People to People International (PTPI).

Should you have any questions, please do contact our Helpdesk[masked] [masked]
how_to_find_us: We shall be at the entrance to greet you
name: SOCIALize

description:
This event offers a special group for the cosmopolitan community in English, in addition to the already popular French-speaking group.

Friendly, fun and relaxed, Speed Dating can help you to widen your circle of friends and find a potential partner. The dating sessions take place at 19h00 and 21h00 and are subject to the number of people participating.

The principle is simple: (At least) 7 men, 7 women and 7 minutes to exchange information and to get a feel for a connection with the other person.

After every encounter, the participants will indicate on a form if they wish to meet one of the people they have just met. Where there is a match, the organizers will connect both people by email, phone or private Facebook message (according to your preferences) no more than 2 days after the event. All contact is discreet and respectful.

The full process will be explained to you when you arrive at the event. There is an opportunity to relax over a drink with your group once the formal part of the evening is over.

For fees, additional information and to reserve your place, please do
SMS or call Xavier[masked]
Or, should you have other questions
email [masked]

Participants are coming from other networks - not just from this group.

description:
10 January - EFT Workshop
19h00 - 21h00
Introduction to EFT, the Revolutionary Healing Method that targets UNRESOLVED EMOTIONAL ISSUES and potential blocks to Vibrant Health, Success, and Well-Being!

EFT applies to all issues, including, anxiety, anger, trauma, fears, phobias, allergies, addictions children’s issues, body pains, dyslexia, breathing problems, relationship issues, sports and performance anxieties, insomnia, serious diseases from migraine to cancer and much more . . .

In our 2-Hour Presentation you will learn the Basic Principles of EFT so you can start using this amazing technique for yourself with confidence

During the practical demonstrations you will be able to use EFT under the guidance of Jeanine, and you are invited to experience the benefits for yourself!

EFT is a safe, easy-to-learn, easy-to-use, non-invasive self-help tool with lasting results

Jeanine Crombé is an EFT Specialist, Trainer & Mentor with more than 10 years of experience. She specializes in EFT exclusively. Her success rate is over 90%

Location: Aloft Hotel, Brussels

Participation is free - voluntary donations are very welcome.

Banking information here.  http://www.ptpi.be/index.php?article_id=9

You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

description:
Do you find yourself sometimes (or often) in low spirits? Having a hard time getting up in the morning? Trying to find the spark back that made you embrace every day anew? Find out how you can find more joy and happiness in your life on a more consistent basis in a few easy steps. Based on the book The Joy of Appreciative Living - Your 28 Day Plan in 3 > Incredibly Easy Steps, by Jackie Kelm, Anita will show you how you too can empower yourself to lead a happier and more fulfilled life.

In this workshop we will discover that there is always another side to each of our stories. By pulling the curtain to seeing the other parts of our lives that are positive and full of opportunities, we can create a different world for ourselves. The goal is not to negate any difficult aspects of our lives, but to put them in context of our whole experience.
> > Anita is a Life Coach and Appreciative Inquiry Facilitator. As a result of her own hard earned lessons she has made it her goal in life to spread the news that we live in the world our stories create and that we all have the power to change the way we look at our lives and achieve greater joy and happiness.
name: Appreciative Living Workshop

description:
Join us on Tuesday, February 19th at Bouche-à-Oreille theater, from 7 PM onwards (show starts at 8 PM) for a stand-up comedy show entirely in English performed by 4 comedians - Christian Schulte-Loh (GER), Geoff Whiting (UK), David Deery (USA) and Joe Eagan (CAN).

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standup (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

Christian Schulte-Loh (Germany) has performed all over the world including Argentina, UK, Germany, Denmark, Slovakia, Hungary, Czech Republic, Holland, Belgium, and countless other countries, and hosts his own one-man show at the Edinburgh Fringe festival. A master at performing for internationally mixed audiences, he is also known as one of the foremost foreign comedians on the UK comedy circuit and headlines clubs across Europe regularly (www.germancomedian.com).

Geoff Whiting (UK) has performed comedy for over 20 years and also runs one of the UK's foremost booking agencies called Mirth Control. An experienced, witty, and down-right funny Englishman that will leave you chuckling with giggles all the way home. A top act not to miss! (http://www.geoffwhiting.co.uk/)

David Deery (USA) is an American comic based in Berlin and has just come off his sell-out tour of the "Mother Fucking David Deery show" - not for the faint-hearted, David absolutely blew audiences away at the recent Copenhagen Comedy Festival as a special guest and we are really looking forward to what he will treat us to this evening - a truely unique act in every sense of the word (http://www.daviddeery.de/).

Joe Eagan (CANADA) regularly tours and organizes shows throughout Benelux and Germany and talks about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss. He will bring a whole new bag of jokes for the evening for those who have seen him before. (www.joestandup.com).

When: Tues, Feb 19. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00

Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels

Entry at the door is 25 euros from 19.00 onwards on the date.
name: English Comedy Night

description:
Hello and Welcome to our EFT Tapping Club!

After a successful series of EFT Live Events last year, many participants expressed the desire to learn more, and have ongoing support to use EFT on a regular basis.

Therefore, I would like to introduce you to our EFT Tapping Club!

Who will benefit?

People who have prior knowledge or education about EFT, or

Open-minded people who are curious about EFT, and would like to see EFT in action and experience the benefits for themselves

I would like to invite you to our next Session where we are going to

‘Leave Procrastination Behind with EFT'!


On Wednesday I will reveal therealemotional reasons
behind Procrastination and we will neutralize them with EFT!

 

If you are struggling with Procrastination, I would like to invite you and join us for this powerful session.

 

When: Wednesday, 13 March, 2013
Time: 19:00 – 21:15 (Meet and Greet at 18:40)
Venue: Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels

Come and Join us for an evening of stress relief, enrichment, education, and inspiration!

Topic for our March Session

I will introduce a new Tapping Topic each month, (however, if you have an urgent issue, then I will include this also)


In March we will....

‘Leave Procrastination Behind' with EFT!'

After a short introduction, I will do tapping demos with volunteers (your privacy is always respected) and you are invited to Borrow Benefits by tapping along.

The goal for our EFT Tapping Club is to provide you with a stress relieving, uplifting, relaxing, educational, and inspiring EFT experience.

At the end of the evening, there will be a draw for One Free 60min EFT Session (value 120€) for one lucky participant.

Fee per Session (19:00-21:15)
• Regular (after 11 March): 70€
• Early Bird (before 11 March): 60€ plus invite one friend for free (optional)

SPECIAL DISCOUNT FOR PEOPLE TO PEOPLE MEMBERS!

50€ (before 11March) plus invite one friend for free!

• Purified water, coffee, tea, biscuits, and handouts are included
Pre-Registration and Pre-Payment: (seating is limited)

Email [masked] with your name and the name and email of your friend*, so I can send them also a welcome message.

EFT for Life
BE[masked]
Bic Code: GEBABEBB
Message: Tapping Club 13 March

*bringing a friend is optional, however if you do, please make sure to send me their name in advance, so we can reserve a seat, thank you.

Mark your Calendar already:
The EFT Tapping Club will meet once/month in the Quaker House
19:00-21:15 on:
• Wednesday, 13 March
• Wednesday, 10 April
• Wednesday, 8 May
• Wednesday, 5 June

If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at [masked], or otherwise, I look forward to connecting with you on Wednesday, 13 March!

Warm regards,

Jeanine
name: EFT(Emotional Freedom Techniques) Tapping Club

description:
After the sold out show in february, we are proud to announce our march event with 4 more great comedians. Same place, same price, same fun !! Be there, and don't forget to book in advance.

 

tickets here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmarch


Here are the artists :

Andy Valvur (USA) - Andy began his comedy career at legendary San Francisco comedy clubs like the Holy City Zoo, Cobbs and The Other Cafe. Since then he has worked at the Comedy Store in Los Angeles as well as the IMPROV and Catch a Rising Star in New York. He has performed in Australia as well as Europe where he recently headlined the Cologne International Comedy Festival. As a writer he has written for the San Francisco Chronicle, Maxim, Cosmopolitan and the New York Times. He was also a writer for political comic Will Durst's Emmy nominated PBS show "The Durst Amendment" and Dan Aykroyd's House of Blues Radio Hour. As a voice-over actor he has appeared in video games such as Star Trek, Top Gun, Psychonauts and others.

Maureen Younger (UK) - Maureen works as a stand up comedian all around the UK and abroad including gigging in German in Germany! Maureen has performed in Austria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovak Republic, Denmark, Sweden, the Netherlands and Germany and regularly headlines the English Comedy Night in Berlin. In the UK gigs range from performing as the warm up act for the Puppetry of the Penis tour to performing on the UK urban comedy circuit. Maureen is also the compere for Crying with Laughter, a major charity night in the London West End which features some of the UK’s top comedians. She also appears as a contributor on BBC Radio and is a weekly guest on the Gaydio Breakfast Show.



Johnny Hollywood (USA) - Johnny is a native of the USA and has lived in the Cologne area of Germany for over 20 years. He runs the very successful Hollywood's Comedy Nights in Cologne and has countless years under his belt performing both stand-up, singing, and other acts. He was even once the Marlboro man on great big billboards! A great observational humourist and a great eye for telling you his take on Europe and European culture in the eyes of an American.

& your host - Nigel Williams (UK/BEL) - The man who needs no introduction is one of the biggest names in comedy in Belgian and Holland and sells out theatres and venues across the country with his one-man shows. Don't miss this chance to see this comedy superstar again and this time he will host the evening!
name: English Comedy Night

description:
Greetings!

We would like to invite you to an informal networking event for the Upcoming Full Day Workshop 'Relationships Magic!' on 28 April in the Aloft Hotel.


This is your chance to interact with the trainers, Jeanine and Ali, and get a first hand impression of what the workshop will be all about.

You will have the chance to:
Ask questions to get a sense of what exactly will you be able to get out of the workshop for your specific needs

- Get a flavor of the knowledge, experience and approach that is on offer

- Discussions on our understandings of relationships, why certain issues occur and the most common pitfalls to avoid

- How even some basic good communication practices can make a huge difference

- How emotional baggage and unconscious patterns can be holding us back from full self expression

*We will be sharing 2 Surprise Bonuses for the workshop offered!*

Jeanine is an experienced EFT (Emotional Freedom Techniques) specialist, trainer and mentor (www.eftforlife.com). Ali is a dynamic performance coach and trainer (www.facebook.com/Coach.AliSohail) certified in NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) and TLT (TimeLine Therapy).

Together, we bring together our diverse, cross-generational client experience, knowledge bodies, and our passion for enriching and enabling the beautiful human experience of relationship!

Come and Join us in the Aloft hotel on the 26 March at 19:00 !

We are looking forward to connecting with you soon.

Jeanine and Ali
name: 'Relationship Magic!'

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

description:
Notworking

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Funky Monkey

Rue Archimedes 65

Schuman

1040 Brussels

(Metro Schuman).

description:
After the very successful show in march, here's our april show, with more great comedians, and a strong scandinavian presence this time.

Isak Jansson (SWE) is one of the foremost comedians on the Scandinavian circuit and widely known as the best Swedish comedian in English. Fresh of off his sell-out one man show in Stockholm called "Everything is the florists fault" he is ready to rock your world with the absurd, downright witty, and charmingly hilarious.

Sofie Hagen (DK) is one the fastest rising stars on the UK comedy circuit after moving to London last year. Already she acheived the following: Winner – Comedy Café New Act Competition 2012, Runner up – Best Urban Female Comedian 2012, Finalist – Funny Women 2012, Finalist – Danish Open in Stand-up 2012, Runner up – Leicester Square New Comedian 2012, Finalist - Piccadilly Comedy Club New Act of the Year 2013.

Rayen Panday (IND) is fresh off his one-man show selling out theatres in Amsterdam and is probably one of the most handsome comedians in Holland. A wonderful joke teller, and also an incredible singer as well as he mixes song into his act now and then - he has the entire package.

Hosted by: Neville Raven (UK) is an experienced London Stand-up Comedian, Radio presenter, Producer and Playwright. As a performer his storytelling style has engaged audiences all over the world. He is happy to play to a rowdy Club audience or a seated Theatre crowd, and his material is guaranteed to be full of surprising twists with a constant stream of laughs.

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupapril (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

When: Tues, Apr 16. Entry from 19.00. Showtime: 20.00
Where: Bouche-à-Oreille theater, rue Félix Hap 11, 1040 Brussels (map: http://goo.gl/maps/01NPe)

Local Knowledge Start your own Business Seminar Tuesday 23 April[masked]h30-18h00

Are you thinking of starting your own business or registering as a freelancer? Have you been offered a contract but aren’t sure whether it is worthwhile becoming self-employed? Are you already running your own business but unclear as to your legal obligations?

Then come to the Local Knowledge Start your own business seminar on Tuesday 23 April from 13h30 to 18h00 and get the answers to your questions. The seminar is run as a series of concurrent round tables so you can speak with each of our five experts in a practical workshop setting.

The seminar takes place at ING, Cours St Michel 60 and is free for ING customers.

For more details and registration, follow the link: http://localknowledge.be/events-2/start-your-own-business-in-belgium-2/

NOTE: IT IS VERY IMPORTANT THAT YOU REGISTER ALSO WITH THE EVENT SITE....

description:
You can sign up for one session at the time
- Want to Sleep better?

- Improve your Eyesight?

- Release Chronic Neck or Back Pain?

- Conquer Stress Headaches and Migraines?

then this Tapping Session is for you!

Bring a friend along and gift them with the gift of EFT!

Did you know that EFT is also highly effective to target the underlying emotional drivers behind Serious Diseases like Cancer, Depression, Heart Disease, and so much more?

Bring your specific questions about Serious Diseases with you, and I will demonstrate how EFT can help you or your loved ones.

SPECIAL DISCOUNT FOR PEOPLE TO PEOPLE MEMBERS! details below

Who will benefit?

People who have prior knowledge or education about EFT, or

Open-minded people who are curious about EFT, and would like to see EFT in action and experience the benefits for themselves

When: Thursday, 25 April, 2013

Time: 19:00 – 21:15 (Meet and Greet at 18:45, so we start right on time, thank you)

Venue: Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels

Come and Join us for an evening of stress relief, enrichment, education, and inspiration!

Topic for our April Session

I will introduce a new Tapping Topic each month, (however, if you have an urgent issue, then I will include this also)

In April we will....

‘Tap into Better Health with EFT'

After a short introduction, I will do tapping demos with volunteers (your privacy is always respected) and you are invited to Borrow Benefits by tapping along.

The goal for our EFT Tapping Club is to provide you with a stress relieving, uplifting, relaxing, educational, and inspiring EFT experience.

At the end of the evening, there will be a draw for One Free 60min EFT Session (value 120€) for one lucky participant.

description:
What: Interactive presentation
Where: Office Brussels

Stress is a pain in the neck and has become one of the most important challenges to our health, well-being, quality of life, relationships and work.

The big question is WHY has stress become such a nuisance and WHAT CAN YOU DO ABOUT IT?

In this 3h workshop Tom and Richard will give insights into to the following questions:

- What is stress?
- What causes stress?
- Why has stress become a nuisance?
- Why does stress make the smartest person stupid, irrational and self-obsessed ?
- What has the conflict between biology and culture to do with anxiety, depression and burnout?
- How can you help yourself and others to relieve stress?
- How can you become more resilient?

Your inspirational speakers for the evening:

Tom Meyers is a speaker, workshop facilitator, Body-Coach and author of the eBook “Reaset: The return of Ease.” Tom works in Brussels (Tomberg, WSL) and has been researching stress from a body-mind perspective for many years. He started his research after his patients - who came for physical complaints like neck back and shoulder pain - commented on significant improvement in resilience, focus, clarity, resourcefulness etc after one treatment. He questioned himself and tried to answer the question, how body-work could have such a positive impact on behavior?

In his interactive presentation, Tom will bring you an answer to this question and will share effective tools to help yourself and others relieve from the negative effects of stress and become more resilient on the way.

Richard Kelly is a qualified Sport Therapist (using the Bowen© and TBM© techniques) and a Golf Specific Trainer, here in Belgium and Europe.


His work on "stress" is related to his clients coming for Bowen and TBM sessions, and seeing how their bodies are affected by stress....
We often live our lives at a much faster and more stressful pace than our body is designed to cope with. Stress has a massive physical impact on the body, though we may often be unaware of its effects. The long-term effects of stress can be devastating. Stress makes us release adrenalin; it tenses our muscles and suppresses our digestion. It contributes to health problems such as high blood pressure, headaches, hormone imbalance, digestive problems and all kinds of muscular aches and pains.


Bowen Therapy is clinically proven to significantly reduce anxiety, tension and fatigue*. Bowen releases muscular tension and helps the body return to the ‘parasympathetic’ nervous system in which it can rest and heal itself. Through gentle movements over muscles and nerves the Bowen practitioner will target the key areas to release tension and anxiety and help get you back to you best.

*Effects of the Bowen Technique on the Autonomic Nervous System and the Heart: by Dr Whitaker MD


IMPORTANT INFO:

Registration: http://hp2bofficebrussels.eventbrite.fr or contact Tom at [masked],

Contact:[masked]

Participation Fee: 25€

description:
Join us again on Tuesday, May 21st for another great Brussels Comedy Night show with more great comedians and a crowd favorite returning for a visit.

Christian Schulte-Loh (Germany) visited us in February and raised the roof so much that we just can't get enough of him. He is a comedy superstar and has performed all over the world. He hosts his own one-man show at the Edinburgh Fringe festival. He is known as one of the foremost foreign comedians on the UK comedy circuit and headlines clubs across Europe regularly.

Soula Notos (GRE) - Born and raised in Holland in a Greek family. Crisis indeed! She knows it by heart. Growing up with shouting and gesturing relatives (small bodies, lots of movement), the only relief was comedy. And now, close to her well deserved pension, she loves to tell stories filled with self-mockery to as many people as possible. She has performed at the Free Fringe in Edinburgh, in Manchester, at the International Women’s Festival in Greece and many clubs and venues across Europe. "Great Energy. Completely original." - Funny's Funny Comedian of the Year 2011 Highly Commended Act.

Louis Zezeran (AUS) - runs clubs in Finland and organized the very first Stand Up Comedy shows in Estonia, using the cleverly named title “Comedy Estonia”. Louis has a like-able connection with the audience when he performs. He often talks to the audience, making jokes with the crowd and letting them become part of the action. Louis likes to make fun of cultural differences, and have a poke at everyone.

Stewart Johnson (USA) - has a knack for picking out the obvious yet hidden quirks in society and turning them into laughs you will never forget. He is an American who is based in Estonia, and has a more mainstream, non-offensive style, frequently drawing upon his experiences as a father. A witty, observational style that will tickle every single one of your funny bones.

Tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupmay (save about 4€ in presale, it will be 25€ at the door)

description:
Basingstoke or Bust- A Gilbert & Sullivan Musical Extravaganza

What happens when a bunch of incompetent pirates turn up at a speed dating contest which the dizzy representative of a popular magazine has organised.....but not very well.....only to find some very colourful characters in fancy dress who can’t stop singing? Add to this an impoverished Duchess, with a past, her daughter who may very well pass for 43 in the dusk with the light behind her and their devoted entourage of....one. Anything could happen. And it does. Come and find out what by coming to see Basingstoke or Bust!

This is a quintessentially British production by Brussels Light Opera Company (http://www.bloc-brussels.com/) based on a new storyline set to the best songs of Gilbert & Sullivan. Fiver performances May 23-May 26.

I am happy to book your tickets for you. Just let me know which date you want to come, your email address and mobile number. BLOC will then contact you for payment by bank transfer.
name: Lets go to see a musical show- Basingstoke or Bust

- Fear of Animals like Dogs, Horses, Spiders,

- Fear of Water, drowning, dreading Big Crowds,

- Fear of sitting in the back of a car because of a previous accident, and much more… then this Tapping Session is for you!

You are welcome to bring a picture or illustration that triggers your specific Fear or Phobia (for example a picture of a spider)

Invite a friend who suffers from Fears or Phobias and gift them with the Gift of EFT, so s/he can experience the benefits of EFT first-hand.

description:
Do you ever get stressed, over-reactive, or frustrated when faced with difficult moments and assume that there must be a better way to handle things?
Do you procrastinate, and then rush through, without doing yourself justice, or feel guilty that you have let people down?
Are you a care-giver, professionally or in your family and wish thatthis role didn’t leave you feeling so burnt out?

If you answer ‘YES’ to any of these questions, self-compassion could just be the answer to help you through life’s challenging and stressful moments, and give you more grace, ease and sense of balance.

Self-compassion draws on research from contemporary psychology together with wisdom from ancient traditions to help us understand the core components of self-compassion

Come along and find out why it works and how it can help you transform stresses in your life to more productive and enriching times, find more kindness for yourself and others, and better appreciate the good moments in life.

The workshop will have a theoretical part, experiential exercises to integrate learning, and time for sharing with other participants.

Prior registration by email to [masked] is required as there is a limited number of places.

The cost of the workshop:
Early booking fee ( Before May 26th ) 25 Euro
Normal fee 36 Euro.
A deposit of 20 Euro will secure your place.

More information here:

http://www.ruthfriedman.com/uploads/1/4/8/1/14816890/june_workshops_a5.pdf

description:
Are you experiencing the loss of a job, of a relationship, a pet, a home, a way of life, a school, your dreams and expectations, a friendship, the death of a loved one?

If you have experienced a loss in your life how do you feel?

- Do you feel sad, angry, lonely, empty, guilty, frustrated, scared and lost, or maybe all of these emotions?
- Or perhaps you are numb and feel nothing at all? 
- Are you afraid to even talk about how you feel?
- Do your emotions frighten you?

Maybe you have a family member or friend who needs your support to cope with their loss and you would like to learn what you can do to help them recover.

This workshop is for everyone who would like to learn a new approach to the grieving process:

- You will discover the natural and healthy nature of loss & grief;
- You will be guided to learn how to deal with your unique grief, your natural reactions and emotions and find your inner resources to recover and live your life wholeheartedly.

Join this workshop and learn a new approach to deal with any kind of loss and grief, even the most intangible ones.

Cost of the event:10 Euros (see link below)

More info and how to subscribe:

http://www.meetup.com/Learning-to-Live-after-Loss/events/120324782/
name: Living Wholeheartedly after loss

description:
Dear friends,


My name is Ali. I live and work in Brussels as a performance coach and trainer!

It seems summer has finally arrived in Belgium, thank heavens for that :) While it lasts then, I would like to invite you for a relaxed Sunday picnic in Brussels's favorite Parc du Cinquantenaire!

I have been following a path of personal transformation for the past years. This being human is a curious experience! My own journey stemmed from the recurring feeling of emptiness, experienced as 'there has to be more to life,' that started in my student years. From resisting to fixing, to finally mining for life's wisdom, the question I am living right now is; " What if life isn't happening to me? What if, life is responding to me?"

I love to share and connect with people, in a training/coaching capacity and otherwise, in celebrating this gift we hold as life!

So, let's co-create a picnic, with fun, socializing, meaningful conversations and with light sport (frisbee, badminton etc)! I will be there with some friends and bring along some food, drinks, a blanket and some sports stuff too. Do join us with your friends and family, more the merrier ;-)

We'll be in the area of the park with the entrance from Av. de Nerviens. Give me a call if you can't locate us at first!

See you on the 16th, bright eyed and bushy tailed!

Ali Sohail

www.facebook.com/Coach.AliSohail

[masked]
name: Picnic Meet Up!

description:
“If civilization is to survive, we must cultivate the science of human relationships - the ability of all peoples, of all kinds, to live together, in the same world at peace.”
- Franklin D. Roosevelt

Success in any area – be it career, family, business, politics or anything else – is largely a matter of building relationships. People who are able to develop and maintain good, mutually productive relationships with other people tend to be much more successful than those who don’t.

Although Building good relationships comes more easily to some people, it is a talent that can be developed. NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) has deconstructed the skills needed and offers an innovative toolbox full of practical approaches that will unleash your relationship building potential in all circumstances.

Building relationships is critical to help you communicate and influence, negotiate, inspire and motivate – whether you are in sales, people management, consultancy, or simply looking to improve your prospects.

In this training, we will explore:

- The dynamics of how communication happens, internal and external.
- How to establish a better connection with others and generate trust.
- How to identify and clarify misunderstanding in communication.
- Increase your ability to create choices and flexibility in managing your states and behaviors.
- How to match your communication to your interlocutor.
- Recommendation of other NLP techniques that can be used at an advanced level.

For whom?

This workshop is an introduction to NLP, from the perspective of relationship building. This workshop is for professionals who wish to be inspired and to develop their personal and professional skills.

Practical details
- 18h00 - 18h30: Welcome
- 18h30 - 21h30: Workshop
- 21h30: Networking space at the bar

Language: English
Date: 2nd of July 2013
Place: Aloft Hotel, Place Jean Rey, 1040 Brussels, Belgium
Price: 125 euro excl. VAT
(Possibility to attend for free at http://building-effective-relationships.eventbrite.com/)

See you on the 2nd!
name: Building Effective Relationships with NLP

description:
Have you ever had the feeling of your world crumbling after a loss or change in your life?

How do you feel when the world is falling apart and you lose the sense of life?

Loss can come in many forms and not just the bereavement of someone close to us. It can be a divorce, the end of a romantic relationship, loss of job, moving, loss of health, loss of your expectations, a pet, a home, a way of life, our dreams and friends….

Every loss and change leads to an emotionally difficult period of grief, and we all need to process our losses and grief.
Grief is a natural and normal emotional reaction to any kind of loss. The reactions and emotions can be many, often complex and intertwined, unpredictable. They are unique for each of us and we can feel uncomfortable with the groundlessness of grieving.

In this discovering workshop, we will review the most common emotions and reactions we experience when our world crumbles, when we lose the sense of our life. We will see through new lenses that it’s possible to make a new meaning of life after loss and be happy again.

A new approach to deal with loss and grief will be shared.

You will discover:
• The natural, healthy and unpredictable nature of loss & grief;
• The importance of processing your grief for making a new sense of life;
• How to find your inner resilience and live your life wholeheartedly again;

The loss has not ended your life. Your life has changed and you need to learn how to live in your “new” life.

This workshop is for everyone who would like to learn about a new approach to deal with loss and grief, even the most intangible ones


Cost of the event:10 Euros (see link below)

More info and how to subscribe:

http://www.meetup.com/Learning-to-Live-after-Loss/events/126035062/
name: When your World Crumbles... ...finding Meaning in your life after loss

description:
Acro yoga is my newest passion and I would love to share this information with our meet up group!

If you feel that you want to try but not sure if you are physically able to do,
Don't worry! Marc is a brilliant teacher who is capable to guide you into the beauty of Acro yoga no matter what level you are!

Saturday = Tulayoga, 10am - 6pm with a 2h lunch break
Sunday = AcroYoga, 11am - 1:30pm + 2:30pm - 6pm

DETAILS:
~ Saturday 10 Aug = Tulayoga:
10am - 6pm with a 2h lunch break
Tulayoga (www.tulayoga.com) is a subtle and powerfully transformative experience that one person gives to another in a private and quiet space, primarily focused on the therapeutic benefits of floating in stillness.
Throughout the day, after preparatory movements and yoga, you will be shown how to begin a basic Tulayoga treatment, how to find and work with the balance points in your arms and legs so that you can support somebody above you, with technique rather than force. You will get an insight into the pleasure of giving and receiving Tulayoga treatments and an understanding of the therapeutic benefits.

~ Sunday 11 Aug = AcroYoga
Two sessions: 11am-1:30pm + 2:30pm - 6pm
With AcroYoga (www.acroyoga.org) expect to light up the fire of Acrobatics and the wisdom of Yoga, blending into a cocktail of giving and receiving, power and sensitivity, skillful communication and.. laughing out loud!
Throughout the day, we will build up the strength and technique of basing and flying, from static do dynamic moves... everyone finding the edge of their abilities in a safe supportive, playful atmosphere.
Each session can be take independently, but both are recommended for maximum benefit :)

~ Marc Bauchet (yogatherapie.blogspot.com) is a certified AcroYoga & Tulayoga teacher from France. From a martial arts and anthropology background he began his Yoga and AcroYoga journey over 10 years ago, along the way met Thaï massage and Acrobatics. He now has a passion to share the fun and healing of these ancient and creative practices.

~ Costs:
Saturday Tulayoga = 85€ (-10€ when paid before 3-Aug)
Sunday AcroYoga = 75€ (-10€ when paid before 3-Aug) or half price for one session
Full weekend = 140€, or 110€ when paid before 3-Aug

~ Registration: Haein Cho,[masked], [masked]
name: Acro yoga workshop in Brussels! Let's play and Fly :D

description:
Dear Bikers,
Have you ever thought cycling to the Belgian coast (from Brugge to De Haan - Return).
There are very nice paths through the countryside. Let’s go on Sunday, August 25th!
The idea will be to go to Brugge in train and rent a bike at the train station. Then at the coast, in De Haan we will have a picnic (everybody brings its own) and have some rest at the beach. Some may also enjoy swimming there. Then we will go back to Brugge in the late afternoon and have a drink in Brugge (or Dame) and take the train back to Brussels. There is also the option to have dinner in Brugge before coming back to Brussels.
The meeting point is at Central Station in front of the ticket office at 10.00 am.
If it rains, everything will be canceled. Let’s keep our fingers crossed so that the weather will be warm and dry ;-)))
name: Cycling to the Belgian coast (from Brugge to De Haan - Return).

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

description:
Recharge, Strengthen, and awaken your true potential after this summer ! Sri Sri Yoga is a beautifully balanced discipline, which offers a multi-path approach for uniting body, breath and mind with awareness. 


A combination of gentle and vigorous series of asanas(postures) is taught for the well-being of the body, while an equal emphasis is placed on techniques for nurturing the mind and spirit.

The course is offered as a series of 6 consecutive sessions of 2 hours each which includes gnana (knowledge), asanas (postures), pranayamas (breathing techniques), yoga nidra (deep relaxation) and dhyana (meditation).

The schedule is outside office hours :
17-20 Sept : 7pm - 9pm
21-22 Sept : 10am - 12pm
The price is 125euros for all 6 sessions and it is open to all levels. Only 10 places left...

Contact : [masked] or 0489331762.

description:
We're back after summer break for a new season of English Comedy Night.

Check our teaser here : http://youtu.be/j4tXXGm4SrE

tickets online here : www.ticketlib.com/standupsept

And don't miss our next show tuesday september the 24th.

Peter White (CAN) has gone on to accomplish a lot in a short time. He recorded his own hour long Comedy Network stand up special, was nominated for Canadian Comedy Award and a Writer's Guild of Canada Award, and appeared in a TV miniseries with Pierce Brosnan. He's performed all across North America and Europe, including the prestigious Just For Laugh's international comedy festival in Montreal.

Paul Myrhaug (CAN) is born and raised in Alberta and now living in London. He lures in his audience with charismatic charm, turns around, and makes them laugh at things they shouldn’t. Fast wit at a slow pace leaves crowds in hysterics and begging for more. Paul tours internationally and has performed for hundreds of thousands of people live, and millions of people on television.

Adam Fields (UK) is a Londoner and now resident in Amsterdam, Adam brings laughter to international audiences with his animated style and humour. With a background in improvisational comedy, his stand-up performances are peppered with spontaneous wit and schizophrenic leaps into other personalities.

Jeroen Leenders (BEL) has catapulted himself onto the comedy scene since 2007 when he was working as a taxi driver in Antwerp. By far one of the most well-known comics in Belgium he has been testing in wings in English of late and wowing audiences everywhere and we can't wait to welcome him to our stage.

And your host Joe eagan (CAN)
name: Brussels English Comedy Night - Tues, Sept 24th

description:
A more centered mind to tackle the year?

Art of Living courses are offered once again in Brussels. A 16-20hr course spread over 4 days (outside office hours) to cleanse every cell of all past emotions, regain clarity of mind, sharpness of thought and concentration, by experiencing the well-known Sudarshan Kriya breathing technique and ancient vedic pranayamas. The course combines deep yet simple Vedic knowledge, meditation, breathing techniques as well as yoga and fun interactive processes to help you connect deeper within and get tools to maintain your balance while facing our times' challenges.

Contact [masked] (fr) or [masked] (eng/fr) for more information.
Next dates : 11-15 Sept (francais) & 26-29 Sept (english/french). Price : 250 euros
name: Art of Breathing

As the newest member to the board of directors of the American Club of Brussels, I wanted to introduce myself. My name is Rob T. I also wanted to cordially invite you and your organization to one of our staple events, “Final Friday”, this September. It will be held Friday, September 27th at the ballroom of the Renaissance Hotel near Place Lux. There is no fee to participate and if you will kindly RSVP, I will have a table for you to present your organization to the guests at the event. Feel free to invite your organization’s members to attend, as well.

Kindest Regards,

-- Rob T. Law

description:
“Maybe you are searching among the branches, for what only appears in the roots.”

― Rumi

Why we do what we do? What an odd question! Isn’t it already obvious that we do the things we do because we actually want to do them? If that were entirely true, then we would not sometimes feel regret or remorse after having done something we allegedly wanted to do, correct? For example, we know we should exercise, eat healthy, be truthful, happy and complain less but sometimes we just catch ourselves doing all these things, sometimes without even realizing – I invite you to join me in finding out why we do this and how we can change it.

Where does this 'wanting' to do a certain thing or perform a certain action come from? And why are we left powerless at times, to act out in ways we know in advance that we will regret?

“And you? When will you begin that journey into yourself?”
― Rumi

The major themes we will be exploring are human existence, the material world, and the need and foundations for happiness. As part of this, we will cover the following:

• How and why we experience life as we do.

• Understanding limiting beliefs; and breaking free from them

• What is motivation and how to sustain it?

• Who is responsible for the life you have right now?

• How to relate to people more effectively?

• Money matters! Why do you not seem to have enough?

• How to increase your conversational influence?

During our time together, I would like you to already be thinking about the following statement and conceptualize how life is currently affecting you – “What if life is not happening to me; what if life is responding to me?”

“The components of anxiety, stress, fear, and anger do not exist independently of you in the world. They simply do not exist in the physical world, even though we talk about them as if they do.”

― Wayne Dyer

This is not a training session or even a workshop. The day is designed to interactively share knowledge and more importantly, to provide a space for personal insights to happen!

We will explore how you can take charge as the creator of your experience of reality and mold a life you would love to live!

Am I a suitable person for this interactive session?

If you are experiencing frustration in some area(s) of your life; if you have had dreams/ideas and have been held back by fear; if your life is good, you’re comfortable with things yet you have this inner feeling that you have more potential in you than what you are living and you would like to get to the next level of success, then this is the space for you.

In short, this day is for those who are willing to take a stand as creators of their own life, authors of their own tale!

“When someone beats a rug,
the blows are not against the rug,
but against the dust in it.”
― Rumi

Program:

09h30 – 10h00: Welcome & intro
10h00 – 11h45: Session
11h45 – 12h00: Coffee break
12h00 – 13h30: Session
13h30 – 14h30: Lunch
14h30 – 16h30: Session
16h30 – 16h45: Coffee break
16h45 – 18h30: Session
18h30: Networking space at the bar

Language: English
Date: 28th of September 2013
Venue: Aloft Hotel, Place Jean Rey, 1040 Brussels, Belgium
Investment Price: 99 EURO (including lunch, refreshments and training material)

Application form: http://tinyurl.com/nsq53fc

Spaces are limited so as to keep the interactive nature of the space. So apply now to be sure you get in.

See you on the 28th!


Ali Sohail
[masked]
www.facebook.com/Coach.AliSohail


About the trainer:

With his passionate belief in human transformation, Ali draws on experiences as an expat professional, coaching and training other professionals to realize their full potential and empowering them to manifest their dreams. Bringing together domains like Neuro Linguistic Programming (NLP), Consciousness Development, Quantum Physics, Western Psychology, Eastern Spirituality, Time Line Therapy, Micro-Expressions & Body language, Ali has his passion in engaging with people around:

- Breaking through limiting patterns and conditioning, and challenging limiting beliefs
- Getting out of negative spirals and creating positive ones
- Creating compelling goals for the future and strategies for continuous focus
- Creating empowering contexts for transformation and breakthroughs to occur

In short, Ali stands unconditionally for your power, in creating the life you would love to live!
name: My Life, My Creation!

description:
‘The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.

You will be asked to make a donation to cover the cost of renting the space (Miinimun 5 Euro).  Please sign up to ensure your place.  (Maximum 8 people)


This meditation is one of a series that are taking place on Sunday mornings before Christmas: October 6th, October 27th, November 17th, December 1st, December 15th.

Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
19h30 : Welcome drink
20h00 : Conference
21h30 : Possibility to eat (reservation : [masked])

Stress has become one of the most important challenges to our health, well-being, quality of life, relationships and economy.

- In 2011 Stress levels increased by 48% according to a global business survey 
- 70 to 95% of all illnesses are related to stress 
- 1.1 million Belgians use antidepressants 
- in[masked],5 million boxes of sleeping pills were sold in Belgium 
- 1 in 4 Belgian employees is at risk to have a burn-out

Tom - Stress Coach for Body & Mind - during his interactive presentation with practical exercises, will address three questions to help you understand and manage stress more effectively.

What is stress?
Why has it become a nuisance?
What can you do about it? 

Participation : 15 € - Places are limited
Reservation required : [masked] or www.cookandbook24102013.eventbrite.com

Infos : www.tommeyers.be
name: Conference: Understanding and Managing Stress

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.

You will be asked to make a donation to cover the cost of renting the space (Miinimun 5 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place. (Maximum 8 people)

This meditation is one of a series that are taking place on Sunday mornings before Christmas: October 6th, October 27th, November 17th, December 1st, December 15th.

Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

Scouting Out Some Fireworks Fun

Remember, remember… The Brussels and Waterloo scouting community are planning to light up the sky on Saturday 9 November.

All the proceeds from what promises to be a sparkling, sizzling and dazzling fireworks night will go towards funding our scouting activities. These activities include training for our leaders, along with our young people, subsidizing camping and the purchase of essential equipment, for example.

So ‘be prepared’ to join the scouts in a night of fabulous, fizzing, firework fun. This event brings in a crowd of about 2000 people. 

Yours in Scouting – 1st Brussels and 1st Waterloo Executive Committee

About Us:

Camping, cooking on campfires, kayaking, sailing, orienteering, cycling, hiking, grass sledging, singing songs, playing conkers … Scouting at 1st Brussels is all these things, and more. We call this everyday adventure: our young people just call it fun. Visit our website here> http://www.1stbrussels.be

description:
After the first 2 amazing gigs of the season, join us on Tuesday November 19th for another evening of international standup comedy with more great comedians from around the world.

Ro Campbell (Australia) is a Scottish-based Australian and was a finalist in the 2007, 2009 and 2010 Scottish comedian of the Year competitions – winning the title on the third attempt. Campbell's award winning brand of cheeky, slightly dark humour has wowed audiences from Adelaide to Bangalore, Helsinki to Singapore and many places in between.

Maureen Younger (UK) is a London-Scot who has spent her entire life as an outsider. She takes us through this struggle in a show which uncovers her identity as a black Scottish lesbian – despite her English accent, white skin and heterosexuality. And when she’s not performing as a comedian, she acts in movies and television series, such as Band Of Brothers.

Wilko Terwijn (NL) belongs to the top of the Dutch standup comedy. Armed with a microphone, he guides the audience into his sharp, but twisted mind, where lurks a strange twist at every turn. Brutally he discusses what should be discussed and is not afraid of dissent. Wilko is always up to date and innovative, so no show will be the same.

William Sutton (UK) is the English-born son of Scottish parents. William was the first native English-speaking comedian in the Netherlands in 1995. Stand-up comedy wasn’t well known in the Netherlands when he started but over 400 shows later (many of which were in the Comedy Café in Amsterdam) William has proven that both comedy and he himself are there to stay.

Jurg Van Ginkel (NL) won the stand-up concours at the Amsterdams Kleinkunstfestival in 2008, and is known for his dark jokes, bizarre fantasies and is not afraid of hard rough either. He's often mistaken for a really poncy native speaker because of his laboratory-bred English accent, Jurg also regularly performs and comperes in English.

Tickets in advance: 20 euro


Tickets at the door: 25 euro


Get your tickets at:

http://www.ticketlib.com/standupnov
name: Brussels English Comedy Night - Tues, Nov 19th

description:
What I often hear from my wonderful clients is that after a few rounds of tapping they tell me: ‘Everything looks brighter to me now’, or ‘I see more clearly’

This idea makes a lot of sense… why wouldn’t our emotions like fear, guilt, anger, and even stress show up in our vision?
These emotions show up in very other part of our anatomy and physiology, why not in our eyesight?


You will learn:
To tap away stress, guilt, anger, sadness, or other conflicts that are ‘hidden’ in your eyesight and experience the benefits for yourself

I will teach you highly effective and very short tapping sequences that you can do daily to improve your eyesight permanently


There are only a few people in the world who teach this specialized knowledge and you will be fortunate to learn this in our EFT Tapping Club


Who will benefit?
People who have prior knowledge or education about EFT, or
Open-minded people who are curious about EFT, and would like to see EFT in action and experience the benefits for themselves


When: Wednesday, 20 November 2013
Time: 19:00 – 21:15 (Meet and Greet at 18:40)
Venue: Quaker House, Square Ambiorix 50, 1000 Brussels


How does it work?
After a short introduction, I will do tapping demos with volunteers (your privacy is always respected) and you are invited to Borrow Benefits by tapping along.

The goal for our EFT Tapping Club is to provide you with a stress relieving, uplifting, relaxing, educational, and inspiring EFT experience.


At the end of the evening, there will be a draw for One EFT Abundance Audio Program (200€ Value) for one lucky participant.


Fee per Session 19:00-21:15
• Regular - after 13 November: 70€ plus invite one friend for free (optional)
• Early Bird - before 13 November: 60€ plus invite one friend for free (optional)
• PTP Members - before 13 November: 50€ plus invite one friend for free (optional)
• Purified water, tea, coffee, biscuits, and handouts are included

 
Pre-Registration and Pre-Payment: (seating is limited)
Email [masked] with your name and the name and email of your friend*, so I can send them also a welcome message.


EFT for Life
BE[masked]
Bic Code: GEBABEBB
Message: Tapping Club 20 November


*bringing a friend is optional, however if you do, please make sure to send me their name in advance, so we can reserve a seat, thank you.


If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at [masked]


I look forward to connecting with you on Wednesday, 20 November!


Warm regards,
Jeanine
name: EFT Tapping Club - Improve your Eyesight Significantly with EFT

description:
Dear comedy lovers, prepare yourself for a real treat on december the 3rd.


We'll have a X-mas special edition of the English Comedy Night, and for that occasion you'll enjoy 2 of your very favorite comedians :


Nigel Williams (UK/Bel) already performed 3 times at Bouche-à-Oreille and raised the roof each time.

Christian Schulte-Loh (Ger) appeared twice and to this day still holds our record in attendance.

Each of them will perform for about 45 minutes, with lots of new material.  This two comedians are the 'crème de la crème' and having them both on the same night is just fantastic !

As for the november edition, there will as well be a pasta corner for those who wish to snack something and socialize before the show.

If there's one show not to be missed, it's probably this one, so make sure you save the date !


Tickets in advance: 20 euro


Tickets at the door: 25 euro


Get your tickets at: http://www.ticketlib.com/standupdec
name: Brussels English Comedy Night (X-Mas Special) : Tuesday december 3rd

description:
For the official launch of our Recycle4chimps campaign,

JGI Belgium invites you to the screening of

"Du sang dans nos portables"

in the presence of Dario Merlo (Director of JGI DRC) and Colette Braeckman (African specialist at Le Soir newspaper).

Follow the track of the coltan mined in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo and used in our mobile phones. The film of the Danish director Franck Piasecki Poulsen, enquires where the resources for our mobile phone industry come from and addresses the problem of the lack in transparency in the supply chain of the brand Nokia.

The screening will be followed by a talk about the region of Colette BRAECKMAN, African expert at Le Soir, and Dario MERLO, Director of the Jane Goodall Institute RDC.
The screening will be in French.
Registrations recommended : through our event page, by E-mail : [masked] – or by phone :[masked]

The screening is organised with the support of the commune of Woluwe-Saint-Pierre/Sint-Pieters-Woluwe and Agenda 21.

Find out how you can also make a difference for people, chimpanzees and the environment in the DRC : join our Recycle4chimps-campaign!
Download and spread the Flyer and the Poster.

description:
“Learning to Live after Loss” is back with a new interactive Meetup!

Christmas is approaching, decorations and Christmas markets are everywhere. Though, you are likely not in the mood for Christmas if you are suffering for a recent loss. Indeed, Christmas often proves to be one of the most difficult times for people who are grieving.

Don’t try and pretend that everything can go on as before and be the same.
You now probably feel the need for something which can unfold your emotions and help you face this holiday time.

Join this Meetup about grief and creativeness and
“Learn through your creativeness how to find and use your inner resources to live fully and wholeheartedly after a loss”

In this interactive workshop, through the use of some creative tools, you will learn how to recognise and identify your losses and get to the awareness of what is making you struggle in your life.
You will discover how different losses can be connected and intertwined and what their impact is in your current life. You will be able to unfold the emotional reactions caused by recent and past losses.

The power of our creativeness gives us access to that inner resilience which is often hidden by the overwhelming pain of our grief.

Learn more at http://www.imaginationclub.org/brussels/event20131211.php

http://www.liveafterloss.org
name: Let's use our creativeness to find our inner resources to live fully after loss”
