description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.

You will be asked to make a donation to cover the cost of renting the space (Minimun 5 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place. (Maximum 8 people)

This meditation is one of a series that have been taking place on Sunday mornings this Autumn.

After this one on December 1st, there will be one more on December 15th.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
Come along to this year’s Vox Pop Christmas Spectacular to hear songs festive and fun to inspire your holiday mood! Brussels’ only show choir directed by Cat Leclerc promises to wow you with hit from Mendelssohn to Motown, including I Got Rhythm, Song for You, The Chanukah Song; We Are Lights, Winter Wonderland. 


Vox Pop will also join our guest artist, Brussels’ own singer songwriter and former frontman of Indie band Apartment, David Richard Caggiari Pallett in singing original songs from his new album, Age of Giants. Come prepared to work for your fun and participate in our festive audience sing along. 

This concert promises to tickle any musical fancy with a wide range of music both festive ……and not. Don’t miss it!!!


Artistic Director/Conductor: Cat Leclerc
Musical Director: Orlin Tzontchev
Guest Artist: David Richard Caggiari Pallett

Tickets: http://www.isb.be/page.cfm?p=3066
name: Vox Pop Christmas Spectacular 2013

description:
Develop your five senses to the point that it gives you the impression of having a sixth, that’s the prupose of Gili’s show.

tickets here : http://bit.ly/J1S5gM

More than a magician, Gili is a mentalist. Could this mean that he can read your mind? This is precisely what he does not want you to believe. Without telepathy or clairvoyance, Gili will even show you his tricks.
With a lot of humor, Gili will take you in the misty world of psychics and hypnotists.

OPENING ACT : Nigel Williams

Nigel Williams has been performing stand-up comedy since 1998. British born but now residing in Antwerp ,Belgium Nigel performs in both Dutch and English. In Belgium his one man shows in the large theaters are regularly sold out and he is a regular guest on TV and Radio.
In English Nigel has performed in Belgium, Holland,Denmark,Finland,Scotland, England, Germany and Estonia.
His stand-up is very energetic and full of audience banter.

description:
A very Happy New Year to you all! A new year begins and with it come new possibilities.


I invite you to take charge of your life and create it in the way you would love to live! Make breakthroughs in your finances, romance, health, spirituality, relationships, business and all around. 


A breakthrough has the power to elevate the quality of your life in one leap. For example, going for financial success without a breakthrough in your relationship to financial success can be very frustrating. 


Its not just a goal setting and new year planning workshop, but a context to create breakthroughs that would make the achievement of your goals an experience of flow and ease.


Join us for a transformative Sunday afternoon on Jan 26 in Brussels. You are welcome to join us starting 2:30 PM and we'll kick off the session at 3PM.


In the spirit of this New Year, this event carries a reduced tag of only 10 EUR and can be paid on the spot.


Given the nature of the process, spaces are limited so to get a spot, REGISTER NOW: http://tinyurl.com/o6m5fdv


To our astounding success,

Ali Sohail﻿

[masked]

-----------------------------

Detailed Description:

-----------------------------


Did you put together some resolutions already? Particular things you'd really like to achieve this year? Is it a new car, a new relationship, a new job, a new house, the dream vacation, starting your own business, moving abroad, better relationship with your parents and/or children and basically any thing that would give you a more fulfilling experience of life?


Come to think of it though, haven't you tried making at least some of these changes before?


Consider this perspective: What you do comes from who you are. Doing is a function of Being. So the results of what you do come from who you are Being while you do what you do. And the results of what you do and what you don't do (which is also an action, a choice) determines the conditions of your life.


By 'who you are' I mean the story you have about yourself, the beliefs, the past conditioning, memories and the unconscious content that make up your identity. For example, let's suppose you decide on improving your fitness and for that, you decide to go for a jog every morning. Now if your story is 'I'm not a morning person,' how many morning jogs do you think you will manage?


And what if you set a goal to make lots of money but the unconscious belief you have running is 'I don't deserve wealth' or 'money is the root of all evil'? And one has internal beliefs about every area of life like this. You can see how this internal conflict can sabotage even the loftiest of goals in any area of life.


Did you change partners but experience similar relationship problems? Change jobs but have similar financial problems? If you're experiencing frustration in certain areas of your life, who you are may be working against what you desire!


Dr. Wayne Dyer put it best: "You don't attract what you want, you attract what you are!"


Take a good look at your life right now. What you have and experience is basically a reflection of who you are. If you commit to something that is outside your experience right now, you would have to grow into someone who you are not yet. You have to break the habit of Being you. 


What you need is a Breakthrough, a breakthrough is Who YOU are such that the results you desire can be with you. That is exactly the purpose for this space, 'Let's make 2014 a year of Breakthroughs!'


What you can expect from this experience:


• Taking the lessons from 2013 and closing the chapter so that space is created for new creations in 2014.

• Clarity over your goals and what Breakthroughs are needed for their achievement.

• Going for the Breakthroughs: a group coaching process will facilitate the Breakthrough process such that 'who you are' works for you, not against.

• Strategies for continuous focus and managing ups and downs.


So much more than being just a goal setting workshop, the invitation is for you to create internal alignment so that you become a magnet for goals!

If you are experiencing frustration in some area(s) of your life; if you have had dreams/ideas and have been held back by fear; if your life is good, you’re comfortable with things yet you have this inner feeling that you have more potential in you than what you are living and you would like to get to the next level of success, then this is the space for you.
name: Let's make 2014 a year of Breakthroughs!

description:
Another great comedy show, not to be missed to begin the year with the best of moods !


For roughly 400 years, the United Kingdom and the United States have been…well… united… in a relationship that runs the gamut from intimate to frosty. Not unlike a really long marriage filled with ups and downs. And yet we stay together because….well….no one else will have us.

This is the central theme of A Special Relationship, the latest stage entertainment penned and performed by, in no particular order, the very British gentleman, Mr. Tony Dunham, and his colonial counterpart, the American, Mister Andy Valvur. In the course of the evening, the handsome pair grapple intimately with such themes as, Chicks, Birds, Cricket, Baseball, History, Humo(u)r, Manners, Politics, Art and Sex.

Here’s a youtube sample : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YIFGwkB1ptA


Tickets in advance: 20 euro

Tickets at the door: 25 euro


Get your tickets at: www.ticketlib.com/standupjan<a href="http://www.ticketlib.com/standupdec"></a>
name: Brussels English Comedy Night : US-UK special, with Andy Valvur and Tony Dunham

description:
We very much enjoy bringing people together to meet and exchange what ever seems important to the group present at the time.

Our coffee mornings are informal get-togethers, where the community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other people, with an international mind-set, living and working in Belgium. Everyone is very welcome - some of our community are locals and we are proud of the multilingual mix of our network and community. 


Our operational base is in Wezembeek-Oppem and this meeting provides an opportunity to see where we work, rest and play. 

If anyone would be interested in hosting an informal meeting, please do let us know.  We will support you to make it happen.

Looking forward to meeting some of you at PTPI Belgium's HQ.

description:
Hello Everybody!

We are setting up a burger & beer event on the 4th of February at 7pm.

We are organizing it for Jean-Louis who owns the restaurant "De Bruxelles et d'Ailleurs" near Madou. (https://www.facebook.com/DeBruxellesEtDAilleurs).


Jean-Louis recently had many administrative and personal problems :

- the "commune" closed his restaurant for a month as he had difficulties in paying the rent. He had to fight to get it back open.
- He had to take care of his wife who was at the hospital.
- At the same moment he had to take care of his young kids.

The commune allowed him to open again but he now has to fight for all the lost time and money.
We wanted to give him a hand by organizing this event for him at his restaurant.

Come along if you wish to meet Beer masters, eat an excellent Cheese Burger (with fries and salad) and spend a good evening all for 19.90 Euros !

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.
You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that wil take place through Spring.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
Welcome to next english Comedy Night!! On Tuesday, Feb 18th, we'll have a fine evening of international standup comedy with great comedians from around the world.

tickets here : www.ticketlib.com/standupfeb


Damian Clark (Australia) - Damian burst into the UK & European comedy circuit in 2005 and within weeks was hailed ‘The Number 1 event to see’ and ‘Cream of the crop’. After several acclaimed TV performances in Australia plus two prestigious comedy awards under his belt, Damian moved to Ireland where teaming up with fellow comic Andrew Stanley, he wrote and co-starred in RTE TV’s I Dare Ya which was the highest rating debut of an Irish TV comedy show to date.

Tiernan Douieb (UK) - Comedian, writer and occasional mixer of herbal tea bags, his solo Edinburgh show in 2011 'Tiernan Douieb vs The World' received rave reviews. Tiernan is also known as one of the best MCs on the UK circuit and we are very fortunate to have him guest the show in Brussels tonight as a guest MC.

Otto Kuhnle (GER) - Berlin-based Otto Kuhnle is a prime example of a versatile German entertainer and actor. He sings, dances, juggles, plays several instruments, does magic tricks and more. A legend in Germany and having made quite a name for himself on the UK circuit, we are honoured to have him grace our stage this evening.

Eric Seufert (USA) – Since moving to Europe, Eric helped found Comedy Estonia, the first English-language comedy club in the former Soviet Union. Stand-up isn’t Eric’s only comedic outlet; he has trained in improv with the Upright Citizens Brigade (NYC) and Coldtowne Theater (Austin, TX) and written for such magazines as the Austinst, Political Derby, and Cracked.com. Eric currently lives and runs a comedy club in Berlin.

Els Vertongen (BEL) - One of the top rising stars in Europe, she is fresh of her New Act Competition win in Antwerp and primed for a stellar career in comedy. The talk of the town in Antwerp, we can't wait to see what she has in store for us in Brussels.

Tickets : 20€ in presale, 25€ at the door.

and as usual :

- Pasta corner from 7 PM onward
- entrance through place Van Meyel
- mandatory vestiaire, but free of charge

description:
Early Bird offer expires 1st February, don't miss out on this amazing opportunity to enhance and change your life forever! 


Are you doing OK on paper? Yet feel deep down and unhappy.

You are stuck in a job you secretly despise, and may have entered a new phase in your life that you just don’t know how to handle.

It can be tough when you don’t feel in harmony with your life.

Striving, yet never arriving can be disheartening when all you really want is to be happy, fall in love with yourself again.

Perhaps meet your soul mate or reignite your current relationship and live a life with ease.

You have had enough but you don’t know how to move out of this place.

Or you want make a difference in the world.

But what if this could all change today?
You had renewed confidence, hope and reassurance that you are on the right path.

You can heal and lift any blocks getting in the way of the life and love you want.

You got recharged, balanced, inspired and guided, and like the fairy tales you fell in love with as a child, you find yourself living the life you have always wanted deep down.

Well this can be your reality if you follow a program taking up 6 Weekends over 4 months run by International Colour Therapist & Trainer Marcia O' Regan. To find out more click www.colourharmonie.com/ict

description:
“The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed.”


― C.G. Jung

Success in any area – be it career, intimacy, family, business, politics or anything else – is largely a matter of building relationships. People who are able to develop and maintain good, mutually productive relationships with other people tend to be much more successful than those who don’t.

In many ways, the quality of our lives is the quality of our relationships! As important as it is, not many of us consciously learn the art of relating to another. Traditional education doesn’t provide it and there isn’t much attention to it in the early years. As a result, most of us have to go about learning what doesn’t work the hard way.

While every body has a unique way of relating, there certainly are definite underlying patterns that differentiate a relationship that works well from one that doesn’t.

I invite you to join us for an afternoon workshop where we will take an inquiry into what may be the secret spice(s) that can make your relationships amazing!

What you can expect from this workshop is:

• Why relate?

• What is it to relate?

• Introduction to the shadow principle

• Conflict in relationships

• A specific section on romantic relationships

• The relationship to yourself

Join us for a transformative Sunday afternoon on March 2 in Brussels. You are welcome to join us starting 2:30 PM and we'll kick off the session at 3PM.

In the spirit of invitation, this event carries a reduced tag of only 10 EUR and can be paid on the spot.

Join us for this transformative Sunday afternoon on March 2 in Brussels. Join us for registration and initial networking at 14h30. The workshop will kick off at 15h00 and will last until 18h00 with a break in the middle.


Given the nature of the process, spaces are limited so to get a spot, REGISTER NOW: http://tinyurl.com/o6m5fdv

To our success,

Ali Sohail

[masked]
name: The Secrets to Amazing Relationships

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.
You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that wil take place through Spring.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
Come walk with us; join Sarah and the People to People community for a two-hour walk on Tuesday 11 March. Meeting point - at the Porte de Hal gateway facing Rue Haute – 10h00 departure.

This two-hour walk will take us from the last vestige of the 2nd city rampart through the ever busy and picturesque Marolles district, the very heart of the medieval city. This is a walk through time, and although there are definite signs of the 21st century along the way, the Marolles proudly retain their old world charm.

As we go along the Rue Haute, an ancient thoroughfare with its colourful history and vibrant personalities, you will discover that each century has left its mark on this fascinating area. The walk ends in the Grand Sablon, a square known for its smart cafés, restaurants and shops.

We ask that you make a small contribution of 5.00 euro per person.  At the time of booking, our system will ask you to make the payment by credit card.  Should you need to pay by another method, please do let us know.

THIS WALK IS FREE FOR PTPI MEMBERS. You need to let us know if you wish to participate.  Max number of place is 8 for this walk. 

Regards

Chalks
how_to_find_us: Sarah will be waiting for you at the entrance to the museum.
name: Walk the Marolles in 2 hours

description:
Wouldn't you agree that what you do is essentially coming from who you are? So the Doing is a function of Being. FCI is a 2-day intense process for transformation at the Being level so that your doing (actions and non-actions) are automatically transformed. And since your life experience is a result of your doings, it is transformed as well! 

Dr. Wayne Dyer put it best: "You don't attract what you want, you attract what you are!" 

So this is an intense process to create freedom at the being level so your experience is that of 'Free to Be' - free to be successful, free to be happy, free to be fulfilled, free to let go of pain and hurt to welcome joy and celebration, free to be your dreams, free to be YOU!

The transformative power of FCI lies in its structure to facilitate insights. The point here is not to share knowledge and theories per se but to create shifts in Being. Let's say you see a snake by the roadside. The instinctive response would be fear. Now when you shine some light, it turns out to be a rope. What happens to the fear? It completely disappears, no struggle on your side! 

An insight has similar power. It causes a shift in Being such that the way you experience the same reality is completely transformed. The whole point of FCI is to create this freedom in the way your experience life!


What you can expect from the FCI experience is: 

• Insight in to how you are creating the reality that you are experiencing right now.

• Strategies for emotional balance and constructive use of emotional energy. 

• Seeing how limiting beliefs work, and growing beyond them.

• Insight into the Power of Consciousness. 

• Harnessing the power of positive Coincidence and Synchronicity. 

• Gaining power over the Law of Attraction. 

• Creating your life from Vision. 

• Having Life work with you 

The two days will be themed as: 

Day 1 - Completing my Past


• Perception vs. Reality

• Communication (relating) 

• What is Consciousness? 

• Thinking, Identity 

• Clarity on what your life is being used for at present 

• You and your mind – who has who? 

• Basic Shadow work

•  Money

• Relationships

Day 2 - Creating my Future  

• Clearing negative emotions:

• Destroying Anger 

• Eliminating the destructive power of Guilt

• Living without Sadness and Hurt

• Moving from Fear to Power

• Getting back in touch with your dreams and inspiration

• Creating and surrendering to your Future

• Crafting a life plan you’d love to live into!

We start around 09h30 on both days. The first evening is open ended and we finish at 18h00 on Day 2.

While a transformative process like this would normally be worth hundreds of Euros at the least, FCI is currently being offered at an introductory price of 95 EUR only, for the whole 2 days!

Given the nature of the process, we would only be working with a small group. Spots are limited so you can register here NOW: http://tinyurl.com/m6b8rfj

Looking forward to co-creating this process of transformation with you!

To our continuing success,
Ali Sohail﻿
[masked]
[masked]
name: Freedom Creator Intensive (FCI)

description:
Welcome to next english Comedy Night!! On Tuesday, March 18th, we'll have a fine evening of international standup comedy with great comedians from around the world.

tickets here : www.ticketlib.com/march14


Bob Maclaren (NZ)

Bob is born in New Zealand and a resident of Amsterdam. He has delighted every corner of the world with his laconic and surprising comedy. A combination of kiwi isolation and the lurid madness of Benelux gives Bob a refreshingly unusual view of life as he sees it. A storyteller extraordinaire with a body language that can be best described as mildly unhinged; his routines have been televised on every continent. A superbly visual performer with razor sharp observations, Bob’s stand up has seen him grace the stages of Montreal, London, Amsterdam and every other corner of the planet.

Dan Gagnon (Can)

A canadian born radio and tv host turned stand-up comedian in the French part of Belgium, Dan Gagnon has filled the Royal Circus in Brussels with his first show two years ago. He is now hosting the 'Dan late Show' on RTBF, belgian national TV. This expat who spent the last ten years in Belgium is just starting to do comedy in English.

Caroline Clifford (GB)

Caroline is from England where she reached the final of the prestigious So You Think You're Funny, Amused Moose and Funny Women competitions. She now lives in Berlin where she co-hosts the incredibly popular We Are Not Gemüsed comedy show Neukölln confessional and Mode7. She is known for her fast wit, dark surreal and imaginative sense of humour.

Drew Portnoy (USA)

Drew traded the mountains of Colorado for the Berlin nightlife over a decade ago. He aims his dry humor and sharp tongue at his biggest enemies: his children and Germans. He performs in both English and German and was a finalist in Berlin-based Quatsch Comedy Club's prestigious annual Talentschmiede competition. He recently acted in a comedy pilot for German TV and won NPR Berlin's 2014 storytelling competition.

Gerrit De Bremme (Bel)

Gerrit is an up and coming talent on the Belgian circuit and a man of IT by day. Probably the only comic in Europe with a decent day job, he has lots to tell about the shenanigans that go on at work, and at home in his lovely big house with his girlfriend in the countryside - a successful Belgian in every sense of the word.

Joe Eagan (Can)


Joe currently resides near Copenhagen and runs the English comedy club there. Founder of InternationalComedians.com, he is also very much a ‘behind the scenes’ kind of guy, organizing and co-organizing countless shows throughout Europe. On stage, he specializes in entertaining crowds with his unique perspective about life in Europe, culture clashes, and lots of other fun things - a maple syrup mix of observational humour you don't want to miss! He is back as host for the evening this month!

Tickets : 20€ in presale, 25€ at the door.

and as usual :

- Pasta corner from 7 PM onward
- entrance through place Van Meyel
- mandatory vestiaire, but free of charge

description:
• How to have a successful life, both professionally and personally? 

• How to find time for ourselves despite our overwhelming programme? 

• How to cope with the daily challenges in a stress-free attitude? 

• What’s the secret of a sound mind in a healthy body? 

We welcome you to a workshop on personal and professional development on Saturday, 22 March 2014! We will learn together how to balance our career and private life, and perform successfully on both sides. Yes, we can be both a successful manager and a devoted partner / parent who finds time for himself / herself – all on the same day! Small changes every day can bring major changes in life. 

Workshop Programme:

09.00 - 09.30 Registration 

09.30 - 10.00 Welcome tea 

10.00 - 11.30 Seminar "Sound mind in a healthy body" (a holistic approach) 

11.30 - 12.00 Warming-up physical exercises (from yoga and pilates) 

12.00 - 12.15 Breathing techniques 

12.15 - 13.15 Lunch break 

13.15 - 13.30 Self-discovery and self-awareness for professional and personal development 

13.30 - 14.30 Seminar Ayurveda: constitutional body types, questionnaire), body type management, recommendations for a healthy lifestyle 

14.30 - 15.00 Mindfullness meditation: visualization of a successful and stress-free life 

15.00 - 15.15 Coffee / tea break 

15.15 - 15.30 Laughter Yoga (comic exercises for well- being and vitality) 

15.30 - 16.00 Biodanza (easy, relaxing and energizing dance) 

16.00 - 16.30 Q&A Session 

Trainer: Cristina Burca, Communication and Lifestyle Consultant 

Location:   La Sagesse intérieure, 32 Rue General Leman, 1040, Brussels

What will you gain if you attend the event? 

• A full day of positive energy, personal and professional development, with an enthusiastic and professional consultant; 

• An ideal combination of information and practice; 

• A holistic approach based on ancient Indian traditions of yoga and Ayurveda, whose purpose is to balance the body, mind and soul;

• Practical exercises which can be easily integrated in the daily schedule; 

• An easy, fun and clever workshop addressed to everyone interested in having a balanced and successful life, both professionally and personally. The practice suggested can be done by anyone, regardless of age or physical condition. 

Cost: 50 EUR 

Places: 15 participants 

Registration: e-mail until 19 March 2014, to: [masked] . 

More information about Cristina, on: https://www.facebook.com/lifestylebranding.
name: Career and Private life: win-win situation! (workshop)

name: Notworking

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.
You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that wil take place through Spring.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
We are a network of people, whom have fun together by enjoying the company of the multicultural individuals and groups that frequent the European district.  We know how tempting it is to go directly home after work and veg in front of the television, or spend time on social media.


Every Wednesday and Thursday evening in the Wxyz bar, you will find a community that come to play, following a hard days work. Because we are a network, our group members and leaders host regular events to ensure a funtastic evening. The PTPI community, Meetup.com groups, Open Mic nights and live music sessions offer a constant flow of entertainment.


Even if you can only stay for an hour, we would love to see you.  Pop in, disconnect your smart devices and re-connect in conversation.

Every Wednesday and Thursday evening from 17h00.  Great music, fantastic location and multicultural people – join our community at the PTPI Hub soon and enjoy the ambiance of the Aloft Hotel Schuman.

Live@Aloft

As the local’s stage for the hottest emerging artists right in the heart of Brussels, we’re bringing you live, acoustic performances once a month at our W xyz bar. Don’t miss out on intimate music moments from the best of the Indie Belgian scene.

W XYZ (Aloft Brussels Schuman)

Just head down to the W XYZ bar to mix, meet and mingle from 17h00. Sip on specialty cocktails, enjoy light snacks and listen to cool tunes. Get your groove on with eclectic beats from sassy DJ mixes every Wednesday & Thursday.

The PTPI Hub network is proud to support the Aloft Brussels events and activities. Please do join us at the Aloft and support every part of our community to grow, connect, understand and appreciate each other.

Need more information?

Do contact the PTPI helpdesk.

description:
April is going to be the standup comedy month in Brussels. Prior to the 'Just For laughs' festival that we co-organize, we are very pleased to offer you another fantastic comedy night on april the 15th.

 tickets here


And that day, make sure you don't miss the return of the mad swede !! Yes, Isak Jansson is back in Brussels. He was amazing last year and one of my very favorite acts. Incredible comedian !!  check him here :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c8L6HDFIRpU

Here's the cast :

Isak Jansson SWE

Isak Jansson is one of Sweden’s top international comedy acts. He has spread Swedish comedy all over the world in places like Russia, India, South Africa, Finland, France, Germany, Belgium, UK, Estonia, China, etc. His comedy style mixes observational comedy with an absurdist touch, all in a high energy physical stage persona. In 2013 he toured with his solo show "It´s the Flourist’s Fault".


Brian Jordan USA

Brian is an American based in Sweden. He has seen the best of the best live at the famous Punchline in Atlanta, but Brian has developed his own style of storytelling comedy. They say that part truth is involved in most comedians’ stories, and Brian is no different. If you figure out which parts of his stories are true, they could shock you. He has been in commercials, lent his voice for audiobooks, and is looking forward to his first movie role, should one come along.

Claus Reiss DK

Best Bagpipe Comedy Show in Europe...…and the only one. The Danish comedian Claus Reiss is the only man in Europe who also entertains with the bagpipe. He uses the odd instrument to play well-known tunes, but in a most untraditional way. He spices up his performance with storytelling and jokes in a close interaction with the audience. Claus Reiss has been on the international comedy circuit for several years now attending some of the world’s biggest comedy festivals. His shows have made people laugh across Europe due to his surprising mixture of bagpipe music, comedy and improvisation.

Manu Moreau BEL

Is he a bird, is he a plane? Well, if he’s up that high, he must be insane! From a small township to the big city, he’s been there, done that and sold the t-shirt. His first steps in comedy weren’t so long ago, but every step since has been closely monitored for your safety. His comedy works similar to cocaine: one line after the other, very addictive.

Soula Notos GRE

Originally from Greece, but now based in Utrecht, she has fantastic energy on stage and a quick-wittedness only to adore and admire. Soula will be our host this evening and we can't wait to welcome her on stage to MC the show.

tickets are 20€ in presale, 25€ on site.

Entrance through Place Van Meyel

Pasta corner on site, cheap and tasty !

Like us on facebook :

www.facebook.com/standupbrussels
how_to_find_us: There will be a Meet Up sign on one of the tables near the bar.

description:
Do you want to be Happy, Find Purpose and Feel Great everyday?

Please do check well the registration process to make sure your place is reserved......

Over time we adopt habits and routines that seem to serve us well. Before we know it, the routine is deep-rooted and we forget why we needed it to begin with.  We hold onto the routines because they are comfortable, or we simply don’t know how to change them.


Now is the right time to change all of that!

Join us on 27 April 2014 in Brussels.  Discover Infinite Possibilities, an actionable plan for change.  Explore the beliefs that fuel our habits, and learn how negative thoughts lock us into our routine.

You owe it to yourself to live the best life that you can, to enjoy today; your present, for it is a gift.

Our seminar will introduce you to the program Infinite Possibilities. You will learn to convert old negative thought patterns into new positive thought patterns, to live the life you want! 

We shall explore the habits and routines that hold us back, learn that taking action is easier than we imagine, engage in lively discussions and exercises and practice visualizing our dreams.  Ultimately, re-programming yourself so that you do feel good every day.

The program is based on the book of the same name by best-selling author, internationally acclaimed motivational speaker and Law of Attraction guru Mike Dooley. This seminar is fun, up-beat and energizing.

Tanya DuVall, Certified Trainer, will facilitate and demonstrate this delightful program using her personal stories, her sense of humor and some good old-fashioned common sense.  Tanya will partner with Mirjam Broeke from the Speelacademie, to lighten your spirits and give you another perspective, turning fears into fun. Together, Tanya and Mirjam will set you on your road to Infinite Possibilities.


Sign up now for a life changing experience and discover that your Possibilities are truly Infinite!

The price for attending this full-day workshop is normally 299€. As a special introduction to Brussels, we are offering the workshop for only 149€! This includes the presentations, the workbook & materials, lunch, snacks and giveaways.  AND MORE... Register before 6 April and this life changing experience is yours for only 99€!

Possibilities are truly Infinite

REGISTER NOW:

1. email [masked]

2.  Transfer the registration fee to:

Tanya DuVall

IBAN: BE[masked]

REFERENCE: April 27 +(name of participants)

3.  Receive your email confirmation

4.  Show up on 27 April – IBIS Brussels Centre St. Catherine.  http://www.ibis.com/gb/hotel-1454-ibis-brussels-centre-st-catherine/index.shtml

Doors open 08h30 with tea/coffee waiting – Workshop starts at 09h00.

Bringing People together makes dreams come true.

A part of the profits form this seminar will be donated People To People International (Belgium)

name: Seminar - Infinite Possibilities

description:
“Not brute force but only persuasion and faith are the kings of this world.”
- Thomas Carlyle

With the connected and interdependent world we live in, never before has the skill of conversational persuasion and influence been of such critical importance.

I invite you to a workshop that is designed to introduce the key influence techniques that are the foundation for success in business, sales, leadership and relationship building. 

Persuasion as a science, not just an art!

Influence and persuasion has often been referred to as an art, but in a sense, it’s a misclassification. What we will be learning in the workshop are scientifically tested and proven strategies for increasing your persuasion skills. 

Even people who consider themselves persuasion lightweights - people who can’t convince a child to play with toys – can learn to become persuasion heavyweights by understanding the psychology of persuasion and by using the specific persuasion techniques that have been scientifically proven to be effective.

What you can expect to learn is:

• At least 6 tested and proven techniques of increasing your conversational influence. 

• How to use these influencing skills with colleagues and co-workers, including your superiors. 

• Influence not just attitudes, but also behaviors. 

• Which strategy is best for developing trusted relationships

• Which strategy is best use during times of uncertainty

• Which strategy is best to use when dealing with people who don’t know you 

• Which Principles are best to use even when people don’t like you 

• How to apply these skills in an ethical way in order to build mutually rewarding long-term relationships. 

• How to say ‘No’ 

• How to protect yourself from unethical persuasion

Pick one specific situation or area in your life where increasing your influence and persuasion will have a positive impact on your life quality. As we work through the process, there would be opportunities to already apply and try on your increased persuasion power in this area!

In the spirit of invitation, this event carries a reduced tag of only 10 EUR and can be paid on the spot.

Join us for this insightful Sunday afternoon on April 27 in Brussels, Belgium.

Registration and initial networking space will start at 14h30.

The workshop will kick off at 15h00 and will last until 18h00 with a break in the middle.

Given the nature of the process, spaces are limited so to get a spot, REGISTER NOW: http://tinyurl.com/o6m5fdv

To our success,
Ali Sohail﻿
[masked]

--------------
About the trainer:

Ali Sohail is an international trainer, motivational speaker and success coach. His passion lies in accelerated human growth and change. He facilitates individuals and organizations to greater levels of performance and empowers them with tools for continuous success. 

Ali is certified in, and uses approaches in modern psychology including NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) with Consciousness Development approaches. 

He works with people and writes about subjects such as overcoming fears, building wealth, persuasive communication, conscious leadership, creativity, balancing the male and female, entrepreneurship and enhancing relationships.
name: Enhancing your Conversational Influence!

description:
Expat Comedian Daniel-Ryan Spaulding is BACK in Europe after a 4 month world tour -- performing in Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Istanbul -- and returning to his hometown of Vancouver, Canada - And now he is back in Brussels to do his new solo show! 

Expect a wild ride through the world of expat culture, national identity, gender & sexuality, family, politics, stereotypes -- and the perils of dating Europeans! 

Personal. Brutal. Honest. Sexy. Hilarious! The perfect night of entertainment for Internations! Grab some beers & have some laughs!

Date : Sun Apr. 27 

7pm - Pre-show meet-up & drinks 

Show: 8pm 

Price: 10 euros

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nARxH4gyUFc
name: "Expat Life"- Stand-up Comedy in Brussels

description:
Join the Just For Laughs International Comedy Festival in Brussels.

DAY 1 of the international week :

Monday the 28th of april :

Get tickets here


Adam Fields (GB)

Adam Fields has been a professional stand-up since 1998. Born and raised in London and now based in Amsterdam, he is one of the top comedians in the Dutch circuit, with several television appearances to his name. Described as “one of the funniest comedians working in the world today,” His style is a mix of sophisticated English and neurotic Jew, with a dash of ‘Crazy Dutch’. And his instantly likeable stage presence allows him to get away with murder. Well, almost. Adam’s main comedic influence is his mother, without whom he would be too emotionally stable to be funny. His hobbies include nordic stalking and collecting dust.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4rSy1Pe2XVY


Rayen Panday (Ind)

Rayen Panday, born and raised in Holland is fresh off his one-man show. After winning the personality award at the Student Cabaret Festival in 2008, he began performing more often and started performing in different TV shows as well as writing for a talk show and a comedy show in Holland. In 2011 he started doing theatre, resulting in his first one man show, performing all across the country. Since then he also has performed more and more in English abroad. He has performed in Denmark, Estonia, Surinam, France, Belgium and Curacao. An incredible singer as well, he has the entire package.


Soula Notos (Gre)

Soula Notos is a Dutch-Greek comedian, actress and host. She is a member of the Utrecht collective Comedyhuis and co-founder of Comedy Kitchen (female comedy nights and promotion of female comedy talent). Her comedy is expressive and energetic. She has performed in Holland, Belgium, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Manchester, Edinburgh, and Greece.

"Great Energy. Completely original." - Funny's Funny Female Comedian of the Year 2011 Highly Commended Act."


Jens Lesthaeghe (Bel)

Jens started performing a while ago and instantly caught the "comedy bug", ever since then he's been performing throughout Belgium and The Netherlands on any open and closed stage he could find. Currently he has over a 100 gigs under his belt and is touring with a group of upcoming comics in line ups all over the country. He won't fill your night up with political or intellectual debate but family woes and annoyances on social media make for enough unhealthy inspiration.

tickets are only 15€ in presale, 20€ on site
how_to_find_us: There will be a Meet Up sign on one of the tables near the bar.
name: Just For Laughs comedy festival day 1

description:
Join the Just For Laughs International Comedy Festival in Brussels.

DAY 2 of the international week :

Get tickets here


Nigel Williams (GB)

Nigel Williams has been performing stand-up comedy since 1998. British born but now residing in Antwerp, Nigel performs in both Dutch and English. In Belgium his one man shows in the large theaters are regularly sold out and he is a regular guest on TV and Radio. In English Nigel has performed in Belgium, Holland, Denmark, Finland, Scotland, England, Germany and Estonia. His stand-up is very energetic and full of audience banter.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XL_F-ddrpRc

Yianni Agisilaou (Aus)

An australian living now in London, Yianni Agisilaou is a headliner all around the world with a mind as sharp as a ginsu blade. His ability to deliver smart but accessible laughter packed material and also to improvise with whatever a room throws at him combine to create a truly unique experience. He regularly performs hour-long shows at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne Comedy festivals. His ability to work in any type of room also sees him in high demand for corporate work.

Andy Valvur (USA)


Andy Valvur is originally from San Francisco where he started doing stand-up in clubs like the Holy City Zoo and The Other Cafe. In New York he was a regular at the IMPROV and Catch A Rising Star. As a writer he has written for shows like "The House of Blues Radio Hour" for Dan Aykroyd and the Emmy nominated PBS comedy "The Durst Amendment" with Will Durst. He has also written for The New York Times, Maxim, Cosmopolitan and the BBC. He is one half of the international political satire series World In Colour as seen on AOL On and is a contributor to the Huffington Post.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4_SjawUi0A

Manu Moreau (Bel)


Manu Moreau, Is he a bird, is he a plane? Well, if he’s up that high, he must be insane! From a small township to the big city, he’s been there, done that and sold the t-shirt. His first steps in comedy weren’t so long ago, but every step since has been closely monitored for your safety. His comedy works similar to cocaine: one line after the other, very addictive...


tickets are only 15€ in presale, 20€ on site

description:
Note - this is an open event and there may not be a member of the organization team present every time. The location is great, the activities are interesting and worth a visit. 


We are a network of people, whom have fun together by enjoying the company of the multicultural individuals and groups that frequent the European district.  We know how tempting it is to go directly home after work and veg in front of the television, or spend time on social media.


Every Wednesday and Thursday evening in the Wxyz bar, you will find a community that come to play, following a hard days work. Because we are a network, our group members and leaders host regular events to ensure a funtastic evening. The PTPI community, Meetup.com groups, Open Mic nights and live music sessions offer a constant flow of entertainment.

Even if you can only stay for an hour, we would love to see you.  Pop in, disconnect your smart devices and re-connect in conversation.

Every Wednesday and Thursday evening from 17h00.  Great music, fantastic location and multicultural people – join our community at the PTPI Hub soon and enjoy the ambiance of the Aloft Hotel Schuman.

Live@Aloft

As the local’s stage for the hottest emerging artists right in the heart of Brussels, we’re bringing you live, acoustic performances once a month at our W xyz bar. Don’t miss out on intimate music moments from the best of the Indie Belgian scene.

W XYZ (Aloft Brussels Schuman)

Just head down to the W XYZ bar to mix, meet and mingle from 17h00. Sip on specialty cocktails, enjoy light snacks and listen to cool tunes. Get your groove on with eclectic beats from sassy DJ mixes every Wednesday & Thursday.

The PTPI Hub network is proud to support the Aloft Brussels events and activities. Please do join us at the Aloft and support every part of our community to grow, connect, understand and appreciate each other.

Need more information?

Do contact the PTPI helpdesk.

description:
Join the Just For Laughs International Comedy Festival in Brussels.

DAY 3 of the international week, wednesday the 30th of april :


Get tickets here


Tiernan Douieb (GB)


Comedian, writer and occasional mixer of herbal tea bags, his solo Edinburgh show in 2011 'Tiernan Douieb vs The World' received rave reviews. Tiernan is also known as one of the best MCs on the UK circuit.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nIP-VZpySIs

Yacine Belhousse (Fr)

Yacine Belhousse is a french standup comedian. He belongs to a new generation of comedy which is developing in Paris. From Batman to cheeseburgers, Yacine touches upon all the typical French subjects. This young frenchman is now taking his standup routine to an international audience.

Adrián Minkowicz (Arg)


Adrián Minkowicz is an Argentinean artist, residing in New York and Brussels. Since 2011, he is a regular at the “World Famous Comic Strip Live” in New York, among other clubs in the city. Between 2012 and 2013, he performed standup comedy in cities as diverse as New York, Buenos Aires, Madrid, Edinburgh, Paris, Oslo, Helsinki, Beijing, Hong Kong and Tokyo, both in English and Spanish. He is also a writer for several specialized comedy magazines.

David Hayden (Eire)


David Hayden is an Irish Comedian Based in Antwerp Belgium. David started stand up comedy in 2009. He was shortlisted for BBC New Comedy Awards 2012 and Finalist for "Show me the funny 2011" Winner of (the much coveted) Battle of the Axe - Ha’ Penny Bridge Inn – Dublin 2010.

He moved to Belgium in 2011 and started the "Cafe Manger Saturday Night Comedy " where he MCs and presents local an International acts. He has played along side some of the best comedians in Belgium, Ireland, Germany and the UK.

Els Vertongen (Bel)


Els Vertongen is fresh of her New Act Competition win in Antwerp and primed for a stellar career in comedy. She's the talk of the town in Antwerp, and we can't wait to see what she has in store for us in Brussels.

tickets are only 15€ in presale, 20€ on site

description:
For the final night of the Just For Laughs Festival in Brussels, we searched for some of the very best comedians around with and found superstars; Al Lubel and Pete Johansson - headlining this show.

Get tickets here

AL LUBEL (USA) :

Al Lubel, the 5 times star of the Late Show with David Letterman and former support for Jerry Seinfeld and Bill Hicks will headline the festival on may the 2nd. Al’s award-winning Edinburgh show ‘Al Lubel is Mentally Al’ mesmerised audiences with his stunningly well crafted and self aware observations full of terrific little asides so much that you’ll never forget his name.

"Al Lubel has one of the very best jokes I ever heard" – Jerry Seinfeld

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l9njUtIl6yE

"Al Lubel is a terrifically funny comedian." - David Letterman

“You’ll never forget his name.” - The Independent

“Al Lubel’s Edinburgh debut has to be one of the funniest shows of the Fringe.” - London Is Funny


PETE JOHANSSON (CAN) :

Pete Johansson is a UK-based comic from Canada who performs all over the world. Pete performed on The Late Show with Craig Kilborn (CBS), and has appeared on Comedy Central’s Premium Blend, two episodes of Comedy Central’s Remix, Open Mike with Mike Bullard (CTV), National Lampoon’s Funny Money (GSN), and in the Showtime film The Incredible Mrs. Ritchie with Gena Rowlands and James Caan. Pete was named a stand out performer by Variety (USA) following a show at the Theatre St Denis.

In addition, Pete has been supporting Reginald D Hunter on his last UK tour, which speaks for itself.

Watch Russel Peters himself introduce Pete Johansson on this TV broadcast.


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1-Nr1T-l2-s

Supremely entertaining" - The Independent

"I'll give you my money back guarantee." - Kate Copstick, The Scotsman

"Provocative, surreal and moving." - The List

"Charmingly dry and smart, Johansson is a wonderfully funny storyteller." - Three Weeks

ANDY VALVUR (USA) :

Andy Valvur is originally from San Francisco where he started doing stand-up in clubs like the Holy City Zoo and The Other Cafe. In New York he was a regular at the IMPROV and Catch A Rising Star. As a writer he has written for shows like "The House of Blues Radio Hour" for Dan Aykroyd and the Emmy nominated PBS comedy "The Durst Amendment" with Will Durst. He has also written for The New York Times, Maxim, Cosmopolitan and the BBC. He is one half of the international political satire series World In Colour as seen on AOL On and is a contributor to the Huffington Post.

YACINE BELHOUSSE (Fr):

And your MC for this night is the newcomer on the international scene : Yacine Belhousse, from the french Jamel Comedy Club is accepting a new challenge in a new language.

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have?
Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings?
Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment?
Would you like to des-stress and recharge your batteries?
Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition.
You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that wil take place through the summer

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

An alien of Standup comedy is setting foot in Brussels this Tuesday 20th of May.

Tickets in presale here


Tony Law (Can) has received the Breakthrough act Chortle award in 2012. People started queing at his shows at the Edimburgh festival. He is coming to Brussels for the first time.

there'll be a pasta corner as usual.

description:
Join us this month for a Serve the City Focus Day.

More than 100 people each month serve in Brussels on a STC Focus Day – now in 5 neighbourhoods around the city.

We call it a Focus Day because we want to see more clearly the needs of people who are homeless, asylum seekers, disabled, elderly, children in need, and victims of abuse. We partner with local social-profit associations serving people in need and create projects in which volunteers can get involved.

But we also want to see our neighbourhoods more clearly. Where do we see beauty in our neighbourhoods? Where do we see brokenness? Attention is action! Each project is a part of a neighbourhood group of projects. Currently we are active in the Marolles, Ste Catherine, Schaerbeek, Ixelles, and Etterbeek. More neighbourhoods to come!

Choose a neighbourhood and then a project. Then there is registration and a briefing for all volunteers, after which volunteers go to their projects. The day concludes with a debrief.

Please join us! Many people doing small things together can make a big difference!

SCHEDULE FOR THE DAY

12:30 Registration
13:00 Briefing
13:30 Leave for projects
16:30 Debrief
17:00 End of day

This month registration is at Epee, rue de l’Epee 8, 1000 Brussels. Debrief is in the neighbourhood where you are serving

To register for a project, please FOLLOW THIS LINK>

For more information - call Chalks[masked]

<a>[masked]</a>
how_to_find_us: There is a team on the Registration desk to greet you
name: Big volunteer day with Serve the City Brussels

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have? Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings? Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment? Would you like to de-stress and recharge your batteries? Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition. You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that will take place through the summer

Looking forward to seeing you there! Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
“If you ask what is the single most important key to longevity, I would have to say it is avoiding worry, stress and tension. And if you didn't ask me, I'd still have to say it!”

- George Burns

It can be said that almost every successful person has his/her challenges with stress. Stress is something that happens when we get overwhelmed by things happening in our lives. Breaking it down further, the only time we experience stress is when our attention leaves the present moment and we get caught up with possible future scenarios that may or may not even happen. One of my favorite quotes around this is from Mark Twain when he says, “I’ve known a great many troubles, most of which never happened!”

If you’re a student, the exams are stressful. When you’re about to graduate, finding a job is stressful. If you get a job, performance and promotions are stressful. If you’re single, that is stressful. If you get in a relationship, even more stressful :) and so the stages go on…

I invite you to consider the perspective that it may not be the circumstances that are stressful; they just are. May be it’s our response, our way of relating to these facts that creates the condition of stress. That may be the stress is coming from our inability to manage our own system, our mind, body and emotions. That stress is a condition created when the inner dimensions of our Being are in friction.

Wayne Dyer put this in the following words:

“The components of anxiety, stress, fear, and anger do not exist independently of you in the world. They simply do not exist in the physical world, even though we talk about them as if they do.”

At a grander level, whatever we experience as a society is a collective manifestation of what’s happening in individual minds. And if the great majority of our individual minds are in regular stress, how can we realistically bring peace and balance to the world?

If we can create stress within ourselves, we can surely transcend it and create ease and a peaceful inner presence instead. It’s a question of breaking the pattern of stress, learning and then habituating the processes for creating this inner well-being!

Has there been a time you were stressed? Are you experiencing some degree of stress at present? Do certain things about your future stress you up? Do you know people who seem to stress you out? Has stress been a theme for you? This might just be the space for you!

The processes and insights you can expect from this workshop are:

• Understanding stress – the role of perception and the biological response

• Identifying the causes of stress – expectations, attachments and dependency

• The 2 truths to stop being in stress mode immediately

• 5 key strategies to transcend and transform stress

• Breaking through stress inducing thinking for which there’s even a smartphone app!

• Stress release meditation

• From stress management to proactive stress avoidance!

In the spirit of invitation, this event carries a reduced tag of only 10 EUR and can be paid on the spot.

Join us for this exciting Saturday afternoon on June 14 in Brussels. Registration and initial networking at 14h30 and the workshop will kick off at 15h00, lasting until 18h00 with a break in the middle.

Privacy and confidentiality will be respected in the group. We will cover the above in the workshop setting and any private conversations will be taken to the drinks after 18h00 at the bar.

Given the nature of the process, spaces are limited so to get a spot, REGISTER NOW: http://tinyurl.com/o6m5fdv

To our success,
Ali Sohail﻿
[masked]

--------------
About the trainer:

Ali Sohail is an international trainer, motivational speaker and success coach. His passion lies in accelerated human growth and change. 

He facilitates individuals and organizations to greater levels of performance and empowers them with tools for continuous success. 

Ali is certified in, and uses approaches in modern psychology including NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming) with Consciousness Development approaches. 

He works with people and writes about subjects such as overcoming fears, building wealth, persuasive communication, conscious leadership, creativity, balancing the male and female, entrepreneurship and enhancing relationships.
name: Beating Stress!

description:
«Quels sont nos moyens de surmonter une changement dans notre vie et de vivre sereinement par la suite?»

• Divorce, perte d’un être cher, rupture amoureuse, perte d’emploi, espoirs déçus, maladie, etc.…

• Vous avez subi une perte quelle qu’elle soit, ou vous vous battez toujours pour surmonter une perte antérieure qui vous fait souffrir?


• Vous connaissez une personne qui souffre et vous ne savez pas comment l’aider et vous vous sentez inutile et frustré? 

Au cours de cet atelier

Nous explorerons le monde des différents changements et pertes qui peuvent arriver dans votre vie.

Nous verrons qu’il est possible d’arriver à vivre sereinement après une preuve douloureuse.

Vous serez guidé dans la reconnaissance et l’identification de certaines de vos pertes et vous découvrirez comment différentes pertes peuvent être reliées entre elles et quel peut être leur impact sur votre vie actuelle.


Gratuit – un petite donation pour la location de la salle est appréciée

Réservation obligatoire:


[masked] / e-mail: [masked], où au secrétariat du Centre Crousse:[masked]
name: Vivre après une perte - Atelier/conference in French

description:
Welcome to our last English Comedy Night before a well deserved summer break !  Join the best internatinoal comedy in Brussels


NEW VENUE, don't forget !! and here's the lineup

Daliso Chaponda (Maw)

Daliso began his comedy career in Canada with the acclaimed one man show ‘Feed This Black Man’. Subsequent appearances across Canada followed (highlights include The Just For Laughs Festival 2005 & CBC Television’s ‘Crossing The Main’).

“A stand up comedian with raw Eddie Murphy confidence, cheek and super-polished style.”
Nerve, Liverpool
“brilliant, thoughtful comic.” - The Gazette Live, Teesside

"Had the audience won over instantly" - Natalie Boxall, BBC Tees

"With his frank delivery, accent and cartoonish voice, he has a unique and endearing stage presence." - Chris Bonaparte, Community Contact, Montreal


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jqhiRHNuCaM

Chris Martin (GB)

Over the last years that Chris Martin supported Jack Whitehall (2011), Russell Kane (2012) & Milton Jones on his full tour for 2013.
He performed a sold out run at Edinburgh Festival in 2011 for his show “Chris Martin: No, Not That One” & is doing his first solo tour in the spring of 2014.
"One of the UK's best young observationalists" – The guardian
"Destined for greatness" – The Sunday times


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_iJphu4mozs

Winter Foenander (NL)

Winter Foenander will host this show. He has a surreal, energetic style with stories on his Dutch heritage and life growing up in Ireland. A few well-placed gags and a story about an engagement that ended due to his fiancées eating disorder, his tangential mind ponders the occupation of Holland, Charity Donations, James Bond, Catholic School Holidays and a song about an Overweight Fiancée.

The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

description:
The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body.’ - Gabrielle Roth

There’s a lot of talk these days about ‘mindfulness’ and ‘awareness’ but what happens when you bring it all down into your body? After all, the body is our home, and one way or another all that we experience happens through our physical body. We can push it hard and make it do things we want it to, we can ignore it if our lives are very sedentary, we can feed it or starve it, we can love it or hate it ……

Do you have a really quick mind, always thinking about lots of things, but you’d like to find that place of calm and stillness that other people seem to have? Do you want to have better contact with your body and your feelings? Would you like to give your body full freedom of expression, and explore how it can change, moment to moment? Would you like to de-stress and recharge your batteries? Would you like to feel a greater sense of vibrant aliveness throughout your day?

If you answer ‘Yes’ to any of these questions, these dynamic meditation sessions are perfect for you!

A dynamic meditation is a set of structured, dynamic movements, which will be guided, together with accompanying music, and followed by stillness. There will be time for sharing with other participants to help integrate your experiences.

Dynamic meditation is suitable for everyone no matter your physical condition. You will be asked to make a donation to cover my costs (Recommended minimum donation 10 Euro). Please sign up to ensure your place.

This meditation is one of a series that will take place through the summer

Looking forward to seeing you there! Each meditation morning is stand alone - come to one or more
name: Mindfulness in Motion - Dynamic Meditation

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

description:
Notworking

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Need more information?

name: Notworking

description:
«Quels sont nos moyens de surmonter une changement dans notre vie et de vivre sereinement par la suite?»


• Divorce, perte d’un être cher, rupture amoureuse, perte d’emploi, espoirs déçus, maladie, etc.…
• Vous avez subi une perte quelle qu’elle soit, ou vous vous battez toujours pour surmonter une perte antérieure qui vous fait souffrir?
• Vous connaissez une personne qui souffre et vous ne savez pas comment l’aider et vous vous sentez inutile et frustré?


Au cours de cet atelier


Nous explorerons le monde des différents changements et pertes qui peuvent arriver dans votre vie. Nous verrons qu’il est possible d’arriver à vivre sereinement après une preuve douloureuse. 

Vous serez guidé dans la reconnaissance et l’identification de certaines de vos pertes et vous découvrirez comment différentes pertes peuvent être reliées entre elles et quel peut être leur impact sur votre vie actuelle.


Gratuit – une petite donation pour la location de la salle est appréciée 


Réservation obligatoire:
[masked] / e-mail: [masked], où au secrétariat du Centre Crousse:[masked]
name: Vivre après une perte - Atelier/conference in French

description:
...without effort!

This hands-on gathering will uplift your spirit.


We will inquire into how life was always meant to be.

We will discover what may be possible in your life (no crystal ball needed)

We will witness reality as a delayed reaction to your consciousness.

If you're new to consciousness as a growth and expansion theme, here's a good intro.

LOGISTICS

Date: September 16, 2014

Workshop Timing: 19h00 - 20h30. You are welcome to join us starting 18h30 for a 19h00 sharp start.

There will be an open ended networking and Q&A space afterwards.

Venue: Aloft Hotel (Place Jean-Rey, 1040 Brussels)

Participation is free and we encourage you to bring your friends along!

See you all there!

ABOUT US

The mission of Creative Consciousness is to raise consciousness and empower people to create the lives they love to live. We do this by offering groundbreaking personal development and internationally accredited coach training. Our trainings are based on extensive research in the fields of psychology, ontology, Eastern and Western philosophy, and over 25 years of experience in human empowerment and coaching.

This evening is given by Creative Consciousness Belgium - find out more about us on www.creativeconsciousness.be
name: How To Catch a Butterfly!

description:
We are back for a new season and a couple great changes!

Our comedy nights will now take place a the Black Sheep (Flagey), where you can enjoy some delicious food and more of a comedy club atmosphere. In addition, this move has allowed us to lower the entrance fee, which will now be of 16€ in presale, and 20€ at the door.

For this first show of the season, we have the fantastic Benny Boot (Aus) headlining. He's been on the UK circuit for over 6 years now, with great success, and several awards.  check this excellent video :


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TnoTHCSFao0


Along with him, Zeid Andersson (Swe) - one of Sweden's best female comedians, Neil robinson (can), Jason Waddell (USA), and your host Joe Eagan (Can).

Save the date in your agendas, and be there for this new season kick-off!
how_to_find_us: Inside the venue, table (s) with Meet Up sign
