description:
Do you have an idea you'd like to pitch?

Are you already pitching and would like to take it up a notch?

Does the possibility of pitching your ideas to potential prospects, investors, stakeholders and interest groups excite you?

If the answer to any of these is yes, join us for an interactive workshop on creating your Perfect Pitch!

That's right, Startup Weekend Antwerp﻿ is bringing you this exciting pre-event, absolutely FREE!

This public workshop is OPEN FOR ALL! Whether you're already in for SW Antwerp or not, you are welcome to benefit from this workshop.

It will be delivered by a startup business expert from Accenture﻿ Belgium, at the KBC Tower in Antwerp.

If you have registered for SW Antwerp or not, you are welcome to benefit from this workshop.

We will start at 19h00 sharp and you are welcome to join us starting 18h30, on September 22.

Register here to be sure you have a spot: bit.ly/1BlOEIo

Refreshments will be served.

See you there!
Ali Sohail﻿
[masked]
Lead Organizer
Startup Weekend Antwerp﻿

description:
English comedy Brussels and Mick Perrin Worldwide
in association with Mandy Ward Artist Management presents

REGINALD D HUNTER IN EUROPE:
A NIGGA RUNS THROUGH IT

tickets here


European Tour 2014

“REGINALD D HUNTER JOINS THE TOP RANK OF STAND-UP COMEDIANS WORKING TODAY…A COMEDIAN GOING FOR BROKE, FLYING IN THE FACE OF RECEIVED OPINION IN A WAY THAT IS SIMPLY EXHILARATING……THIS IS COMEDY OF A RARE SCOPE”
*****Times


Following sell-out tours of the UK and Australia and critically acclaimed debut tours of New Zealand and Scandinavia Reginald will be bringing his own unique blend of humour to Belgium this year

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tuq8ZU2Uf_0


In the fifteen years since he began performing, Reginald D Hunter has become one of the UK Comedy industry’s best-known and most distinctive performers. His work is often brutally honest, frequently controversial but always meticulously measured and thought out.


Reginald’s popularity has led to him being invited to perform in venues around the world in places such as Singapore, Hong Kong, South Africa, New Zealand and The Sydney and Melbourne Comedy Festivals.
“SHIMMERS WITH STAGE PRESENCE…COMIC TIMING IS SHARP ENOUGH TO BURST BALLOONS”
Independent
name: REGINALD D HUNTER  in Brussels

description:
Hi everyone!

Join us for this special, transformational workshop about how to be happier, realize your personal power, and keep your uniqueness and integrity within your relationships. You will acquire tools and techniques that will help you remain calm, focused and emotionally stable in different life situations. Understanding our emotions and learning to manage them is, after all, the most important step towards the creation of amazing and fulfilling relationships. Be ready to look deep inside yourself and transform your life! 


For more information about the event, please check out the following link: https://www.smore.com/4b2av

Hope to see you there!!!

More information

The event consists of 3 parts/practices. You can participate in the whole event or choose one or two practices.

Participation fee for each practice: 20 euro

Participation in the whole event: 50 euro

Make sure that you wear comfortable clothes and that you come in with a big smile!!!
name: Understand Your Relationships - Transform Your Life!!!

description:
Come and walk with us; join Sarah and the People to People International (PTPI) community for a two-hour walk on Monday 29 September. Meeting point - at the Porte de Hal gateway facing Rue Haute (Brussels 1000) – 10h00 departure.

This two-hour walk will take us from the last vestige of the 2nd city rampart through the ever busy and picturesque Marolles district, the very heart of the medieval city. This is a walk through time, and although there are definite signs of the 21st century along the way, the Marolles proudly retain their old world charm.

As we go along the Rue Haute, an ancient thoroughfare with its colourful history and vibrant personalities, you will discover that each century has left its mark on this fascinating area. The walk ends in the Grand Sablon, a square known for its smart cafés, restaurants and shops.

Please do register, as space is limited.  Should you reserve a place, we would appreciate it very much that you do show up.  No shows deny others the opportunity to participate.


For more information, please contact our Help Desk ([masked]) 0478.482.023.

Your guide will be:

Sarah Strange

Qualified Tourist Guide CERIA 2004

skype: wurzel1170

Twitter @poetinthewoods

BLOG: www.poetinthewoods.blogspot.com

About PTPI

The vision of People to People International is that a network of culturally knowledgeable global citizens will be an active force in creating and sustaining a more peaceful world.

Believing that it is through connecting people across borders and cultures that we build the relationships that create understanding, the mission of People to People International is to offer multinational experiences that foster cross cultural learning, develop global leadership skills, and connect with an international network of people committed to making a positive difference in the world.

Because in an increasingly interconnected world, success in making a positive difference will come to those best prepared to work and lead across borders and divides, People to People International provides innovative ways for people to experience, learn, lead, and connect.

www.ptpi.be
how_to_find_us: Sarah shall be waiting in the parking area for you.
name: A walk in the Marolles area of Brussels

description:
www.saveurstoscanes.be

TASTE OF TUSCANY

Tuscany is coming to the Arsenal in Brussels for a unique weekend event from 3rd – 5th October 2014, with an early autumn festival of Tuscan tastes and flavours.

Saveurs Toscanes will be an ideal opportunity for visitors to plunge into the region’s typical, unique way of life, with more than 50 exhibitors, especially here for the occasion. 

Beyond the tourist, showcase view of Tuscany, the festival highlights bringing visitors together to meet and talk with some of the best, most exclusive food and wine producers in the region, through a sensory journey of savours and delights. There will be culinary demonstrations, conferences, workshops; wine tastings given by oenologists, food tastings and chances to discover new trends in modern and authentic living. 

Saveurs Toscanes celebrates its 10th Anniversary this year and is the initiative of DOLCE VITA, the Belgian-based specialists for holiday rentals in the region.

Saveurs Toscanes this year shares its solidarity with Give Eur Hope by offering a part of pre-sales entry ticket.

Tickets already available at www.saveurstoscanes.be <a>www.toscaaansesmaken.be.</a>

And reductions and fantastic prizes: Free tickets, 1 dinner for 2 in a Brussels based Tuscan restaurant, 300€ to spend in 'goodies' at the event or elsewhere and 1 home stay holiday in beautiful Tuscany, are given away in a contest in Dolce Vita's facebook page.

Come & Taste it !
name: Saveurs Toscanes - Toscaanse Smaken

description:
Are you a wantrepreneur and would you like to have your own startup, or be part of one? 

Are you in a day-job but fantasize about having you own startup and would love to learn how Information Technology (IT) can help you make it happen? 

Do you have a startup already, or are a part of one and want to make a breakthrough in your use of IT to grow your startup? 

Well then don’t we have just the right gig for you: come join us on September 29, 2014 for a Bootcamp on IT for Startups! 

This is a 3-hour workshop, based around helping you learn about the tech and development skills needed to build a startup business, at Startup Weekend and beyond! You will also be able to inquire about Startup Weekend and how it can dramatically accelerate your entrepreneurial journey. 


The format will be as: 

17h30 – 18h00: Welcome and registration 

18h00 – 19h00: Project Start, Architecture and useful tools 

19h00 – 20h00: Lean development and agile programming 

20h00 – 21h00: User experience and User Interface. 

We will kick it off at 18h00 sharp and have lots of interesting content to cover so do be on time! 

This event is FREE and will be hosted at the KBC Towers in Antwerp. Food and drinks will also be provided as a walking table during the workshop.

Register here to be sure you have a spot!

Please bring your own laptops along! Charging sockets and WIFI will be provided.

See you there!

Ali Sohail﻿
Lead Organizer
Startup Weekend Antwerp﻿
name: Startups IT Bootcamp

description:
(We will meet at 10:00pm outside the entrance of Herman Debroux Metro (next to the Shell gas station). My tel is[masked] - Alexander. Call if you cannot find me .

 Also For those who are going to come by Metro we will be back to the metro station 10 min before Midnight so you can catch the last Metro back!)

Dear Friends, on Wednesday October 8 we are going to participate in a ceremony in the forest, for healing our purposes from the past memories (heavy energies) and receive a spiritual cleansing during the period of the October full Moon.  This Full Moon in some shamanic tribes is called the Hunter's Moon because from this period started the hunting. It also signifies the period for setting targets, putting goals and start your "hunting period" in every endeavor in your life! 


Come and join us to receive healing and information about your future, connect with shamanic spirits for health, empowerment, better relationships and abundance in this ceremony that will last approx. 2 hours.
This Full Moon though is more important and for another reason. There is also a total eclipse of the moon that is happening the same day (in Brussels is happening around noon Oct 8).


The total eclipse represents a time where the portal of the subconscious will be "locked" for a while and people will have a chance to look deeper into the reasons of their beliefs and inspirations or sufferings. You can have a chance to make deep changes in your life at this time (if you are ready and willing). 

So join us for a deep spiritual transformational shamanic ritual with the drum and the tarot cards!

Participation cost 20 euro - For the intention
Bring with you warm clothes and flash light! See you soon!! (under the moon)

Alexander - Northern Deer

Self Development Coach - Healer & Educator in Family, Business & Life Management
name: Full Moon & Total Eclipse Of The Moon Ceremony - In The Forest De Soignes

description:
Brace yourselves! The first ever Startup Weekend in Antwerp is here!

With over 1,800 past events in 500 cities around the world, Startup Weekend is the biggest global grassroots movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs who are learning the basics of founding startups and launching successful ventures.


Have you ever felt the urge to:

- Pitch your idea?
- Form a team around your idea and make it real?
- Get grilled by some of the toughest industry experts
- Get coached by the best
- Present to a panel of expert judges and win amazing prizes?
- And test the limits of sleeplessness? ;)

If the answer is yes, then chances are, you’re a crazy-ass entrepreneur and you should probably join Startup Weekend in Antwerp!

This will be the 1st event of its kind in Antwerp where the local startup ecosystem will join in for a three day marathon of co-creation, co-learning and growth-hacking!

Check out the Startup Weekend trailer here:

http://vimeo.com/28872840

All Startup Weekend events follow the same basic model: anyone is welcome to pitch their startup idea and receive feedback from their peers. Teams organically form around the top ideas (as determined by popular vote) and then it’s a 54 hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, business coaching and market validation. The weekends culminate with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback. It isn’t always pretty. It will be challenging and can be grueling. But, if you can stick it out, you will have gained the equivalent of months worth of learning, building, and networking in one weekend. Hell, you might even start your first company!

Whether you start companies, find a cofounder, meet someone new, or learn a skill far outside the usual 9-to-5, everyone is guaranteed to leave the event better prepared to navigate the chaotic but fun world of startups. The event will be held in English.

More details and event schedule here.

Startup Weekend Antwerp﻿ is expected to sell out well in advance so book your place now!

The prices here includes event materials, business coaching, mentoring, working space for the weekend and meals and snacks for the whole weekend (Friday till Sunday dinner)!

You can work overnight at the venue as well. Sleeping arrangement is not included so you have to arrange for just that. The venue is quiet central so there will be a lot of hostel options around. Check out www.hostelsclub.com and http://www.hostelworld.com for hostel options, and www.airbnb.com for apartments.

Looking forward to seeing you all there!
Ali Sohail﻿
name: Startup Weekend Antwerp

The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)

Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

description:
Master I – A new state of consciousness is a 4-day breakthrough process that opens up a whole new world of possibilities.

Why should you do Master I – A new state of consciousness?

Whenever people are asked what they ultimately want from life, it mostly comes down to one of these key words: happiness, fulfillment, and freedom. But why does it not come naturally? Why is it often a struggle to achieve and maintain this?

How often do we feel stuck and frustrated in our lives because of the same old negative patterns that tend to not go away, no matter how hard we try? It seems sometimes almost impossible to turn things really around, not just for a moment. Think about those days that you wake up and your thinking and feeling says: today is not my day? But what if exactly on that day you need to give an important presentation or are having an important meeting? How do you manage yourself? In general, what do we need to do differently in order to overcome fears, insecurities, negative self-talk, and other negative sabotaging patterns and to become the creator of our reality and experiences?

The first step would be to become AWARE of how you function as a human being. You need to know exactly what determines how you behave, think, feel, act and experience reality. What makes you tick, what drives you? Why do you do what you do and feel what you feel? You need to find out what is holding you back and what stands in between you and doing what you really want to do and being who you want to be. Once you become aware of what shaped your life and yourself, you can take the second step: acquire the power to start setting yourself free from limitations and breaking down the wall of negative conditioning that has been determining most of your life so far.

Master I – A new state of consciousness takes you through these two steps, and even further. You will see for yourself how consciousness is the crucial factor to gain control over negative sabotaging patterns and to finally create a self-determined reality. You will gain new awareness, connection to your inner power, clarity on your way forward, and practical tools needed for creating your life the way you choose to.

How does Master I work?

Master I is a dynamic and holistic training process facilitated by an international team of our highly skilled trainers. We create a safe space in which you can internalize and directly implement new knowledge instead of just receiving information. Each training day contains inquiries and awareness creations combined with exercises and individual as well as group process designed to integrate the insights you acquire. A comprehensive training workbook supports the process.

Master I main themes:

Freedom – feel free, act free, be free
Passion – create the life you love to live
Energy – tap into your core energy and use it for constructive purposes
Clarity – see clearly what you want to accomplish in life
Integrity – align your actions with your words
Awareness – perceive reality as it is
Authenticity – stay true to who you choose to be
Presence – be fully in the here and now
Love – love without conditions
Action – act independently from thinking and feeling
and much more….

As the result of Master I, you will acquire new life skills and develop daily practices that will lead you towards creating major lasting shifts in your life.

Master I is a personal development training well as the foundation training of the coach training curriculum and a prerequisite for becoming a Consciousness Coach®.

What are the practical details?

Training days
Master I consists of 4 training days, from Thursday till Sunday. Each day starts at 9 am, evenings are open-ended. On Day 4 (Sunday) we finish at 6 pm sharp. All trainings take place in Brussels, Belgium. Participants are responsible to secure their own accommodation, when needed. Details on the venue and a list of accommodation possibilities will be send to registered participants.

Your investment
Price for individuals:
Master I is offered on the basis of Valuation after the Experience model (VAE).
This is how it works:
your investment prior to the training is EUR 195 Registration fee incl. VAT, needed to book your seat and cover the logistical costs (meals, drinks, venue, training materials).
On the last day of the training you decide how much you choose to pay for the value you got out of the training. You fill out the VAE form, where you indicate how much you choose to pay for the training. You can pay the full amount at once or in up to four instalments.

Why do we offer Valuation after the Experience (VAE)?
Firstly, we want to make the foundation trainings (Master I and Master II) accessible for as many people as possible.
Secondly, we want to create a relationship between you and us basing on responsibility and trust. We acknowledge that attending the trainings might involve some risk for you, and we are willing to bear this risk. Through VAE model we give you the possibility to first experience the trainings, and then decide how much value you received and how you express it in terms of money.

(The market value of Master I is EUR 795 incl. VAT.)

Price for corporates: EUR 1195 excl. VAT

How to sign up?
Fill out this registration form: http://www.eventzilla.net/web/event?eventid=2139030123

or send an email with your contact details to: [masked]
name: Master I

description:
First time ever in Belgium: a gathering of Belgian Startup Weekend alumnus (participants, facilitators and organizers)!

• Have you attended or organized a Startup Weekend? 

• Have you heard about Startup Weekend and are curious to find out more? 

• Are you active in the Belgian startup ecosystem, or are looking to get active? 

• Would you like to network with the entrepreneurs and community organizers in Belgium? 

• Do you want to meet the partners, sponsors and supporters active in the Belgian startup scene? 

• Are you excited to get involved or observe as the Belgian Startup Weekenders hack on the evolution of the Belgian entrepreneurial ecosystem? 

If your answer to any of these is even a 'may be,' you gotta be part of the first ever Belgian SW Summit!

**NO TALK, ALL ACTION**

Get in here!

This is a Belgian Startup Weekender re-union, an Xmas gathering and a hackathon on the evolution of the Belgian ecosystem - what can be the next steps to take Belgium forward and what projects can we initiate/create?

Here's the agenda flow: 

09h30 - 10h00: Welcome croissant and registration
10h00 - 11h30: Opening Ceremony
11h30 - 12h15: Pitches (120')
12h15 - 12h45: Idea selection (top 10) and team formation
12h45 - 13h30: Networking lunch
13h30 - 18h00: Growth Hacking time!
18h00 - 20h00: Closing Ceremony
20h00 - 22h00: Dinner & Drinks

We start with the opening ceremony at 10h00: the importance of Startup Weekend as a catalyzer for the ecosystem, the beginnings of SW in Belgium, SW success stories and SW Organizer stories. An overall picture on the Belgian startup ecosystem, with its current opportunities and challenges will also be presented.

The objective is to get inspired about the potential for evolution in the BE ecosystem and excited to step up and create projects!

Then we'll get in to pitching ideas (120 seconds/pitch) on potential events/projects to implement in 2015. We’ll make teams around the top 10 ideas (by open voting) and hack for the afternoon - SW style ;-)

The results will be presented in the closing ceremony. There will be no jury panel or winners in this format. The purpose is for the project teams to showcase their work, get all the support they need from the experts, community leaders, sponsors and partners present, and hit these projects off in the next days/weeks!

Along with the above flow, You will be able to:

- Network and meet alumni from other SWs as well
- Talk with and learn from organizers
- Get more info about the all program of Up Global, Startup Digest, SW Next, Startup Weekend Vertical, Startup Weekend Education

There will be pop-up workshops during the afternoon on:

- Lean Startup principles
- Learn how to organize a SW event (first steps, spoc, peer-to-peer sharing with organizers)
- Marketing for startups
- Subsidies and tax benefits available for startups in Belgium
- Team dynamics and founders agreement
- Top legal pitfalls for startups, and how to avoid them
- Identify the actions to be taken in the 3 regions of Belgium with local actors to support entrepreneurs and create synergies


Past SW sponsors, partners and supporters have also been invited.

This is the first step for organizing a SW Organizers summit next year, inviting organizers from France, Germany, Netherlands and Belgium and hack on cross-border collaboration and evolution. If you're interested in joining that project team, get in touch with myself and the organizing team on the day. 

Places are limited, this is hot cakes so book your spot here NOW!

See you in Leuven on Sunday, December 7! 

Ali Sohail 

Lead Organizer 

Belgian SW Summit 

[masked]
name: Belgian Startup Weekend Summit

description:
Welcome to all the adventurous souls, dreamers, travelers and friends! The Travel Capsule is the "birth" of the free spirit, the adventurous soul and of a mind with the motto "I am realistic - I expect miracles to happen". Nothing is impossible at this realm and the greatest adventures always begin from within us! The Travel Capsule is created to give us the opportunity to see nature's and this world's most beautiful places and phenomenon and to get the chance to enjoy and connect with pure nature and other people, to contemplate about life's miracle and infinite possibilities and to experience the unity that exists in this world and of course the most important to have an adventure!! This December 2014 the "Travel Capsule" will teleport us to the magical Finish Lapland to witness nature's most sensational light show, the Northern Lights or else known as Aurora Borealis!

IMPORTANT: Please take the time to read all of the information provided in the flyer. https://www.smore.com/8g3md-aurora-borealis-magical-adventure
----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Travel adventure in a nutshell!

What? Adventure travel to hunt Aurora Borealis or else known as Northern Lights, winter activities (huski safari, Aurora camp, Aurora hunting with snowmobiles, energetic practices, astrological prediction, sauna, massages)

When? 12th December 2014 - 15th December 2014

Where? Finish Lapland, Saariselkä, Finland

How? The closest airport is Ivalo airport, Finland, from there the hotel service will transfer us to the hotel.

Cost? Standard packages plus airplane tickets (See the flyer by clicking the link above
name: AURORA BOREALIS MAGICAL ADVENTURE !!!

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Funky Monkey

Rue Archimedes 65

Schuman

1040 Brussels

(Metro Schuman).

Need more information?

Chalks Corriette

[masked]

Email: [masked]

You can find out more about our events at this Meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/socialNIB/

We are self-funded and make every effort to offer our service free at point of use. Voluntary donations are very much appreciated. With your support, we do make a difference.

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

description:
Notworking

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Funky Monkey

Rue Archimedes 65

Schuman

1040 Brussels

(Metro Schuman).

Need more information?

Chalks Corriette

[masked]

Email: [masked]

You can find out more about our events at this Meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/socialNIB/

We are self-funded and make every effort to offer our service free at point of use. Voluntary donations are very much appreciated. With your support, we do make a difference.

PTPI Generosity line:

[masked] - 2 € each time you call

[masked] - 6 € each time you call

[masked] - 11 € each time you call

This is an automated service that takes about 10 seconds to register your call and charge your phone bill the agreed amount.

Banking details for PTPI:

Bank:[masked] IBAN:

BE[masked]

BIC: BBRUBEBB

PTPI ASBL/NGO registration number:[masked]

For donations by credit card: PayPal [masked]

Should you have any questions at all, please do call the PTPI Helpdesk 0478.482023.

To learn more about People To People International Belgium, do visit our web portal at http://www.ptpi.be

We care about our reputation. Should you have any comments, we invite you to share them with us.

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

Aloft Brussels Hotel
Place Jean Rey
1040 Brussels
(Metro stop Schuman)
[masked]
http://www.aloftbrussels.com/  

Need more information?
Chalks Corriette
Cell:[masked]
[masked]  
www.ptpi.be  

Need directions to Aloft? Do visit Google maps http://maps.google.com/ 
for the best solution from your starting point.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI
[masked]
[masked]

Please donate:
Bank account:[masked]
IBAN: BE[masked]
BIC: BBRUBEBB
how_to_find_us: Close to the Wxyz bar - or ask at Reception
name: Job Club and Coffee Morningss

description:
Notworking

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Funky Monkey

Rue Archimedes 65

Schuman

1040 Brussels

(Metro Schuman).

Need more information?

Chalks Corriette

[masked]

Email: [masked]

You can find out more about our events at this Meetup page: http://www.meetup.com/socialNIB/

We are self-funded and make every effort to offer our service free at point of use. Voluntary donations are very much appreciated. With your support, we do make a difference.

PTPI Generosity line:

[masked] - 2 € each time you call

[masked] - 6 € each time you call

[masked] - 11 € each time you call

This is an automated service that takes about 10 seconds to register your call and charge your phone bill the agreed amount.

Banking details for PTPI:

Bank:[masked] IBAN:

BE[masked]

BIC: BBRUBEBB

PTPI ASBL/NGO registration number:[masked]

For donations by credit card: PayPal [masked]

Should you have any questions at all, please do call the PTPI Helpdesk 0478.482023.

To learn more about People To People International Belgium, do visit our web portal at http://www.ptpi.be

We care about our reputation. Should you have any comments, we invite you to share them with us.

People To People International Belgium
We are a small team that volunteers each week to build a strong community in Belgium. Our funding comes from individual donations, some sponsorship and fund-raising activities. Our current location at the Aloft Hotel has served us well. There is ample space, free wifi, spaces to talk, sofas to sink into with reading material, refreshment facilities and great public transport connections.

People with jobs to offer will send us a short outline of the position they want to fill. These can be for formal roles, informal roles, and/or ad-hoc needs for help. We shall share these with our community. We can also post information about people looking for a position.

More about People To People International Belgium
The ‘Capital of Europe’ is a bubbling melting-pot of cultures, businesses and associations. There are people from each corner of the world and every walk of life living and working in Belgium. This makes our chapter an ideal organization to connect the dots and offer people a space to develop friendships while building strong communities.

We are a member-driven community, made up of some volunteers and some paid personnel. We take full advantage of the traditional tools of business and technology and are designed to operate as a co-operative. Donations of skills, goods or money are very welcome and help us to continue to build strong communities in Belgium.

Chalks Corriette – President PTPI

name: Job Club and Coffee Morningss

description:
Job Club and Coffee Mornings

Every Thursday 09h00 to 14h00


The People To People International coffee morning is an informal get-together where our community can have a chat and enjoy some time with other international people living and working in Belgium. You can pop in and out when it suits you, collect a survival guide, ask questions and meet members of our team.

For many people in Brussels the traditional methods of looking for work are not adapted to out-of-the-ordinary roles and circumstances. This is equally true of people offering work that is unusual or different. People have always said that finding a job requires a lot of networking and that is often the case.

description:
Notworking

Shake off the working week in good company! We are a mix of internationals and locals who meet in the Funky Monkey, a London-style pub in Schuman. Notworking provides the perfect opportunity to meet new people, widen your circle of friends and have fun. It’s an informal, flexible get-together from 19h00 onwards. You can work it around the rest of your evening - just pop in for a quick drink or stay on till late...

First Friday of every month from 19h00

Funky Monkey

Rue Archimedes 65

Schuman

1040 Brussels

(Metro Schuman).
